item.title: The 8 Biggest Wedding Registry Trends for 2016
item.description:
Curating a list of gifts you’d like others to buy for your wedding is tricky--mainly because it’s not the easiest thing to predict the items you’ll want/need/continue to use 'til death do you part. That’s why to help inspire your selections, we pulled together this list of chic and unique registry items (and experiences) that are all the rage right now.

Image credit: West Elm

RETRO APPLIANCES

RETRO APPLIANCES

The KitchenAid mixer might be the most overplayed--and under-used--registry item ever, but the vintage-inspired pastel hues it comes in are a trend that’s just picking up steam. Even if you don’t register for a full-on fridge (though it is an option), you can go smaller with a retro teakettle or toaster. Practical and pretty. 

SMEG ($1,999)

Image credit: Twenty20

FLOWER SUBSCRIPTIONS

FLOWER SUBSCRIPTIONS

Fancy vases are out; once-a-month flower deliveries are in. Think about it: What would make you happier? An expensive vase that you get tired of and want to replace after a year of use or a fresh delivery of coral peonies that arrives at your doorstep once a month? Yeah, we’re gonna go with the peonies.

Flower Muse (starting at $329) 

RELATED: How To Dry Vases and Wine Bottles So They Don’t Mildew

Image credit: Williams-Sonoma

PORTABLE GRILLING EQUIPMENT

PORTABLE GRILLING EQUIPMENT

Park picnics are the best. We’re not saying BBQs in your backyard aren’t great, but having the option to take your meat (and corn and shish kebobs) on the road is the future--and a lot more “life” friendly.

O-Grill ($199)

Image credit: West Elm

BAR CARTS

BAR CARTS

Sure, they’re a decorative way to stash your booze, but you can also use them to transport hors d’oeuvres (and delicious beverages) from the kitchen to the screen porch…or wherever it is you’d prefer to entertain.

West Elm ($399)

Image credit: Club W

ANYTHING WINE-RELATED

ANYTHING WINE-RELATED

There’s always a reason to upgrade your stemware. But brides are upping the ante and requesting wine-of-the-month subscriptions, too. (Yes way, rosé.) 

Club W (starting at $52 a month)

Image credit: Zola

ANYTHING CHEESE-RELATED

ANYTHING CHEESE-RELATED

Slate boards are the prettiest--especially covered in a range of soft and creamy cheeses--but you can also use them (and stainless-steel cheese knives) to elegantly serve hors d’oeuvres, charcuterie or open-faced sandwiches.

Brooklyn Slate ($33) 

RELATED: Throw Together a Gorgeous Cheese Plate For Under $25

Image credit: Zola

EXPERIENCES

EXPERIENCES

Sometimes you don’t really need anything, which is why Zola makes it possible to seamlessly create a Pinterest-like registry of not just gifts, but experiences, too. It’s a breeze to set up: Just upload a photo of whatever it is you’re looking to do as newlyweds (go to the movies! take a pasta-making class!) and request a dollar amount. When a guest purchases, the cash goes straight to your account (minus a small transactional fee).

Image credit: Puppies Behind Bars

CHARITY DONATIONS

CHARITY DONATIONS

Plumfunds--a new site from the creators of Honeyfund--streamlines the fundraising process. So if you’d prefer to ask guests to give to your favorite charity (like Puppies Behind Bars) in lieu of gifts, you have all the tools you need to quickly build a website championing the cause, collect the funds and cash out.

RELATED: 7 Charities To Give To This Year

item.title: The Best Summer Tops for Every Body Type
item.description:
Shopping with girlfriends is the best. They can dish about that Bachelorette episode you missed and hold your place in the dressing room line while you second-guess a gorgeous silk number you saw out of the corner of your eye--all while delivering an honest opinion about what looks great (and, fine, not so great) on you. So consider us your BFF the next time you’re on the hunt for a new blouse, and go for one of these six styles that’s fit to flatter.

Image credit: Damsel in Dior

BROAD SHOULDERS

BROAD SHOULDERS

OK, we’ll admit it: We’re suuuper jealous of your athletic build. (And we sympathize with how frustrating it can be to hear your tiny friends complain about their bra straps always falling down.) An understated peplum silhouette will add balance and volume to the bottom half of your torso. Then, pair with denim flares for a ’70s vibe that’s totally in this season.

Get the look: INC ($18); French Connection ($58); Anthropologie ($88)

Image credit: Bisous Natasha

LONG TORSO

LONG TORSO

It’s, like, the oldest trick in the book, but horizontal stripes really do give the illusion of width, acting as a necessary contrast to your elongated waist. Rock it with an A-line skirt or high-waisted trousers to minimize your torso even more and add length to your legs.

Get the look: Forever 21 ($16); Kate Spade ($68); Acne Studios ($150)

Image credit: Sincerely Jules

PETITE

PETITE

Calling all small girls: This summer, opt for a V-neck blouse in a breezy, lightweight fabric. The silhouette will stretch out your frame and make you appear taller by drawing the eye up to your collarbone and away from your midsection.

Get the look: Pleione ($35); Ann Taylor ($80); Paige ($189)

Image credit: Gabifresh

FULL FIGURED

FULL FIGURED

As simple as it may sound, a clean white tee can actually make the biggest impact. Soft fabrics like slub knit will hug your curves in all the right places and, when paired with your trusty white jeans, will perfectly pull off that trendy monochromatic look you've been dying to try out.

Get the look: Target ($9); Lane Bryant ($13); Charlotte Russe Plus ($18)

Image credit: Suburban Faux Pas

BIG BUST

BIG BUST

In the heat, you likely want to shy away from form-fitting styles. But that’s not always the best option for curvy gals like you. Instead, go for a peasant blouse with an elastic seam at the waist. The hourglass-defining shape highlights your womanly curves rather than creating a tent-like situation. 

Get the look: H&M ($15); White House Black Market ($60); Bishop + Young ($110)

Image credit: Atlantic Pacific

SMALL BUST

SMALL BUST

Accentuate your upper torso with a shoulder-baring top that you’ve been eyeing everywhere this summer. An off-the-shoulder number draws the eye up and out and emphasizes your slender frame, while the elastic above your bust creates more dimension below.

Get the look: Zara ($50); Bailey 44 ($148); Milly ($295)

RELATED: The Best Summer Dresses for Every Body Type

item.title: Attention: Caffeine Has No Effect if You've Had 3 Nights of Crappy Sleep, Says Science
item.description:
Image credit: Christopher Robbins/Getty Images

You know the drill: get a lousy night’s sleep, drink coffee, feel better, repeat. Not so fast Pike Roast fiends.

According to a new study from the Walter Reed Institute of Research, the old-coffee-cures-a-headache trick only works for the first two nights of tossing and turning. After that, you’re kinda out of luck.

The study followed 48 participants who each limited themselves to five hours of sleep for five nights in a row. Half the folks took a placebo and half drank a big cup of coffee, two times a day. For the first two days, the caffeine group scored better on aptitude tests and reported feeling happier than the placebo participants. But after three days, the two groups flip-flopped, with the coffee drinkers’ mental alertness dropping drastically--and overall levels of “crankiness” noted.

The upshot? Coffee works in a pinch. But in the long term, you have to treat sleep like a real priority. 

RELATED: 7 Ways to Actually Get 8 Hours of Sleep
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Blue Wine Is Officially a Thing (Thanks, Spain!)
item.description:
Image credit: @GikLive/Instagram

Red, white, rosé--when it comes to wine, it’s safe to say you’ve tried them all. Or have you? Word outta Spain is that there’s a new wine on the market and, FYI, it’s blue.

Yep, Gik is the company behind the new--and predominantly sweet-tasting--blend. It’s made from a combination of red and white grapes sourced from vineyards near León, located about three hours north of Madrid. As for the blue hue, that actually comes from anthocyanin, a pigment found in grape skin. (The plant dye indigo and a non-caloric sweetener are also added.)

Right now, the wine is only for sale in Spain, but it’s scheduled to hit Europe this summer, followed soon by the U.S. That means that at this time next year, you could be pouring red, white and blue wine for the fourth of July. 

Just think of the Instagrams.

RELATED: Sangria Is Out, Wine Cocktails Are In
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Welp, this "Little Mermaid" Fitness Class Just Blew Our Mind
item.description:
Image credit: Hotel Del Coronado

Pop quiz: Which Disney character has the best abs? If you guessed Ariel, you’re in luck. There’s a new workout trend that will help you get a super-toned mermaid bod without having to live under the sea for the next 20 years. But we’re sure you have other questions…

What exactly is "mermaid fitness"? It’s a type of exercise class in which you put on a glittery spandex tail with a bunch of other mermaids and mermen and swim around the pool.

Does it actually work? Swimming on its own is an excellent way to burn calories and build muscle, and by limiting the movement in your legs, you’ll be giving your core, butt and thighs an even more intense workout. Plus, it looks like the funnest thing ever.

Where can I take this magical class? Mermaid classes are currently being offered in Michigan, Toronto, Montreal and at the Hotel Del Coronado in San Diego, but we imagine they’ll be popping up all over the U.S. in the next few months.

Wait, where do I get my tail? They’re typically provided by the class, but if you’re really serious about this whole mermaid thing, you can buy your own (and give it a whirl at home). Sorry, thingabmabobs aren’t included. 

Related: The 7 Best Swimming Holes in America
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 12 Wine Terms Every Wine Lover Should Know
item.description:
You’re out to eat and seeking the perfect glass of red to go with your steak. You flag the waiter, who asks: Are you looking for something earthy or fruit-forward? You freeze. Never again, thanks to our handy guide to all those weird wine words.

Element 1

FULL-BODIED

This word is used to describe the texture of the wine. Think of full-bodied as the difference between whole vs. skim milk. If you’re looking for something lighter, ask for something light- or medium-bodied, depending on your preference. 

RELATED: How Much Wine Should I Actually Be Pouring?

EARTHY

This word is less about taste and more about aroma. So if you prefer a white that smells like fresh-cut grass or a red with a scent like the woods, earthy is your go-to.

BLEND

All this means is that the wine was made from an assortment of different grapes. For example, most bottles from Bordeaux feature a grape combo. (Think 65 percent Cab Sauv, 35 percent Merlot.)

Element 2

FRUIT-FORWARD

Not to be confused with “sweet,” this actually refers to wines that are dominated by fruity flavors. For example, that Sauv Blanc with a hint of citrusy lemon or the Montepulciano that tastes like delicious Maraschino cherries.

OAKY

You know how wine gets aged in barrels? Oaky refers to the range of flavors that come from that--like the bottle of Zinfandel that tastes smoky and coffee-like. Or the Pinot Noir that tastes like chocolate.

SAVORY

The term “savory” is used to describe bitter flavors found in more vegetable-leaning fruits (like bell peppers, tomatoes and olives). Common savory wines include Sangiovese, Nebbiolo and Cabernet Franc.

Element 3

SWEET

If you use the word "sweet," it’s pretty much assumed you’re looking for a dessert wine. Think: tawny port or Muscato. Goes great with Tiramisu.

DRY

Basically, it’s like saying you want the opposite of sweet. If you despise dessert wines, this word is your fail-safe at the bar. 

RELATED: Why You Should Never Order The Second Cheapest Wine On The Menu

MINERALITY

If you have an affinity for crisp, dry rosés, ask for a glass with robust minerality. It’s the polar opposite of buttery and oaky. And it has a synonym in the wine world: earthy.

Element 4

BUTTERY

Use this if you prefer a white--like Chardonnay--that’s creamy and smooth when you swish it around your mouth. 

TANNIN

This word describes compounds found in grapes that make your lips pucker. High tannin wines can actually make it feel like your saliva has evaporated with each sip.

CORKED

This refers to something (bad) called cork taint—which happens when a cork (which is a natural substance) gets contaminated before your wine is bottled. You’ll know if your glass is corked because it will smell like wet dog.

RELATED: The Terrible Thing That Might Happen If You Store Your Wine Vertically
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: What Your Sleeping Position Says About Your Health
item.description:
After a long day, there’s nothing like hopping under the covers for some blissful sleep. But, as it turns out, the way you do it can help--or hurt--your body. Here’s the deal on the three most common sleeping positions and what they mean for your health.   

Image credit: PeopleImages/Getty Images

If you sleep on your back...

If you sleep on your back...

Congratulations, this is the best way! Sleeping in a supine position (on your back), is best for your spine and neck, since you’re maintaining a neutral position and aren’t contorting your body. In a more vain vein, sleeping on your back is also best for preventing wrinkles, since you aren’t smooshing your face into a pillow for eight hours. The only con to back-sleeping is that it could make you more prone to snoring or sleep apnea. If you sleep this way and notice yourself snoring, trying propping your head up (but not too much) with a pillow.

Image credit: Twenty20

If you sleep on your side...

If you sleep on your side...

Side-sleeping isn’t the best option, but it’s also not the worst. It is, however, the most common. In general, sleeping on your side can cause nerve compression in your arms and legs, which could lead to chronic pain. And weirdly, it also matters which side you sleep on. It’s better to lie on your left side, which may reduce heartburn and improve digestion. So, if you must sleep on your side, make sure it’s on your left and try placing a pillow between your knees to provide extra support for your back.

RELATED: 5 Tips for Side Sleepers

Image credit: Twenty20

If you sleep on your stomach...

If you sleep on your stomach...

If back-sleeping is arguably the best way to rest, stomach-sleeping is the worst. Laying flat on your stomach causes a lot of neck strain (since you have to turn your neck to a 90-degree angle in order to breathe) and flattens the natural curve of your spine, which could lead to lower back pain. If you sleep on your stomach, it’s highly advisable to train yourself to sleep on your side or back. (Sorry.)
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: The Safest, Easiest Way Ever to Remove an Avocado Pit
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

We put avocado in, well, pretty much everything, but whenever it comes time to bust out our chef’s knife to remove the pit, we get a teeny tiny bit nervous. (Sharp knife + bad aim = yikes.) This trick seems much safer…and easier, too.

What you need: An avocado and a corkscrew

What you do: After you halve the avocado, twist the corkscrew into the center of the avocado pit you’re trying to remove. As soon as it feels securely hooked in, pull out the pit.

Yay, no injuries! And you’re eating avocado? Today’s a good day.

RELATED: 9 Avocado Toast Recipes You Need To Try Right Now

item.title: 15 Secret Menu Items You Can Totally Order at Your Favorite Restaurants
item.description:
Our eyes were recently opened to Starbucks’ Pink Drink, an off-menu option that tastes like a strawberry milkshake, but better. That got us thinking about other secret menu items at some of our favorite fast-casual spots. Here, 15 items you won’t see on the menu, but can and should get from everywhere from In-N-Out to Chipotle.

Image credit: Joits/Flickr

Element 1

In-N-Out: Animal Style Fries
Order: Fries with melted cheese, grilled onions and Thousand Island dressing.

In-N-Out: Neapolitan Milkshake
Order: A milkshake with a mixture of vanilla, chocolate and strawberry ice creams.

In-N-Out: Grilled Cheese
Order: A cheeseburger with all the fixings, minus the actual burger patty. 

In-N-Out: Protein Style Burger
Order: A cheeseburger with two pieces of lettuce instead of a bun.

McDonald’s: Apple Pie McFlurry
Order: A plain McFlurry with a hot apple pie mixed in and topped with caramel.

McDonald’s: The Air, Land and Sea Burger
Order: A Big Mac with a fish filet patty and a chicken patty.

McDonald’s: McCrepe
Order: Pancakes and a yogurt parfait. (Then spread the parfait on the pancake and fold it in half.)

Starbucks: Nutella Frappuccino
Order: A Coffee Frappuccino with two pumps of mocha and one pump of hazelnut.

Starbucks: Cotton Candy Frappuccino
Order: A Vanilla Bean Frappuccino with two pumps of raspberry syrup.

Starbucks: Cap’n Crunch Frappuccino
Order: A Strawberries and Crème Frappuccino with caramel, hazelnut and toffee syrups.

Shake Shack: Ice Cream Sandwich
Order: Frozen custard and two grilled hamburger buns. Assemble yourself by putting the custard between the buns.

Shake Shack: Shack-cago Burger
Order: A burger with the toppings from the Chicago-style hot dog.

Chipotle: Quesarito 
Order: A burrito made with a quesadilla instead of a plain flour tortilla.

Chipotle: Nachos 
Order: Tortilla chips covered in beans, meat, cheese and sour cream.

Chick-fil-A: Blueberry Cheesecake Milkshake
Order: A vanilla milkshake with a slice of blueberry cheesecake blended in.

item.title: Splurge vs. Scrimp: The Clothing You Should (and Shouldn't) Spend a Lot On
item.description:
Heyyyy, big spender. One day you’re stocking up on flip-flops at Old Navy and the next you’re shelling out a couple paychecks' worth on that gorgeous Chloe crossbody you’ve been drooling over for months. So where do you draw the line? We’re here to give you a nudge in the right direction with six items worth the extra cash--and six you can totally save on.

Image credit: Christian Vierig/Getty Images

Denim Jeans: Splurge

Denim Jeans: Splurge

Sure, it’s easy to find denim for less. But based on the fact that you’ll wear them with everything, go for a quality pair that’s worth the few extra bucks and fits you like a glove. 

Get the look: AYR ($175); J Brand ($228); Re/Done ($324)

Image credit: Christian Vierig/Getty Images

Denim Jacket: Scrimp

Denim Jacket: Scrimp

Since fit isn’t as important for the jacket versus the pants, you can find a million styles that won’t break the bank and look just as expensive as the designer version.

Get the look: Forever 21 ($35); Gap ($40); Asos ($45)

Image credit: Christian Vierig/Getty Images

Workwear Blazer: Splurge

Workwear Blazer: Splurge

It’s one of our worst fashion nightmares: Sitting in an important meeting in an itchy polyester blazer that looks as if you snagged it from the bottom of the sale bin. Trust: The amount of times you’ll wear this staple (and the impressions that it'll make) will definitely compensate for the higher price tag.

Get the look: Club Monaco ($269); Anine Bing ($300); Elizabeth and James ($465)

Image credit: Melodie Jeng/Getty Images

Workwear Blouse: Scrimp

Workwear Blouse: Scrimp

We don’t know about you, but we can’t tell that much of a difference between one rayon blouse and the next. And since you’ll probably gravitate toward trendier styles to switch things up, it’ll be cost effective to spend less on each. 

Get the look: Mango ($30); Ann Taylor ($50); Banana Republic ($78)

Image credit: Journelle

Bra: Splurge

Bra: Splurge

Don’t risk the pain and frustration of bargain hunting for good, quality lingerie. Get fitted by an expert and spend a (worthy) pretty penny for the sake of your gals, since you’ll probably wear it more than anything else you own. 

Get the look: Chantelle ($74); Journelle ($84); Cosabella ($133)

Image credit: Christian Vierig/Getty Images

T-Shirt: Scrimp

T-Shirt: Scrimp

All cotton tees are not created equal…but they’re pretty darn close. And since (presumably) you’ll be throwing it on to go grocery shopping or walk the dog, you can totally settle for the ten-buck option.

Get the look: H&M ($10); Uniqlo ($10); Topshop ($12)

RELATED: The Best Times of Year to Buy All of Your Clothing (and Save)

Image credit: Kirstin Sinclair/Getty Image

Heels: Splurge

Heels: Splurge

Genuine-leather pumps are a thing of beauty and will last you for years, unlike easy-to-spot faux leather. Since you can’t go wrong with nude or black, break the bank for a designer pair that you’ll wear forever (and that will feel much better on your feet). 

Get the look: Cole Haan ($200); Stuart Weitzman ($365); Christian Louboutin ($675)

Image credit: Kirstin Sinclair/Getty Image

Flats: Scrimp

Flats: Scrimp

Sure, you’ll wear them a lot, but that’s why they get gross and grimy so darn quick. Grab any cheapie pair that you won’t cry over when they fall apart after a few seasons.

Get the look: Payless ($30); Guess ($30); Chinese Laundry ($49)

Image credit: Melodie Jeng/Getty Images

Leather Tote: Splurge

Leather Tote: Splurge

Remember when your mom passed down her beautifully beaten-up old tote to you in high school? Same idea. A real leather carryall will last you for decades and never go out of style. 

Get the look: Cuyana ($225); Marc Jacobs ($395); Mansur Gavriel ($585)

Image credit: Georgie Hunter/Getty Images

Clutch: Scrimp

Clutch: Scrimp

On the other hand, these smaller accessories go in and out of fashion depending on the shape, pattern, fabric, metal accents, etc. Look for an off-brand version with minimal embellishments so it lasts you more than just one season.

Get the look: Merona ($15); Urban Outfitters ($39); Madewell ($50)

Image credit: Twenty20

Sneakers: Splurge

Sneakers: Splurge

Don’t give up important factors such as arch support and breathability to save a few bucks. From your weekly jogs to trampoline class (and everything in between), a decent investment in running shoes will pay off. 

Get the look: Under Armour ($140); Adidas ($180); Nike ($200)

Image credit: Twenty20

Workout Pants: Scrimp

Workout Pants: Scrimp

The truth? You can definitely look great and feel good in a pair that’s not Lululemon. We know, blasphemy, but spandex is pretty much the same across the board, so don’t get too caught up in designer names. 

Get the look: Old Navy ($10); FILA ($18); Athleta ($30)

RELATED: 9 Secrets of Women Who Exercise Every Day

item.title: This French Baby Was Serenaded by Irish Soccer Fans and It Kind of Made Our Hearts Melt
item.description:
When we think about diehard Irish soccer fans, we a picture a rowdy group of men's men more prone to aggression than random acts of kindness. 

But a delightful new viral video has proven us very wrong. In it, a group of Irish soccer fans (in France for the UEFA European Championship) adorably sing a French baby to sleep on a train in Bordeaux. 

Between delightful renditions of "Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star" and "Hush, Little Baby," the fans (a few with beers in hand) can be heard shushing other train passengers, lest they wake the little one up. 

So today's lesson is don't judge a book by its cover: Especially when there's a tiny human involved.

If you’re like us, you’re still a bit confused by Snapchat. You get the general premise, but aren’t sure who to follow. We’re already on board with Reese Witherspoon, Chrissy Teigen and Kate Hudson, to name a few, but today we added a super exciting user to the lineup: A one Michelle Obama. Her account’s debut is tied to her upcoming trip to Liberia, Morocco and Spain on behalf of Let Girls Learn, the White House’s initiative to promote girls’ education. Expect behind-the-scenes photos and video of her work, as well as posts from actress-slash-activists like Meryl Streep and Freida Pinto.

item.title: The Easiest Way to Zip Up a Dress When No One's Around
item.description:
Image credit: Stockbyte/Getty Images

You’re getting ready for a cocktail party and are super jazzed about your dress. It’s pretty much perfect, aside from the fact that it has a punishingly long zipper down the back and you’re home alone. But seriously, this dress is bananas and not wearing it is not an option. Here’s what you do.

What you need: A long ribbon, string or shoelace.

What you do: Thread the ribbon/string/shoelace through a gap in the zipper, and then step into the dress. With one hand, grab the ends of the ribbon behind your back and pull it over your shoulder. As you pull, it will zip all the way up.

Why it works: Because you’re an independent genius--that’s why.

item.title: The 10 Best Korean Beauty Products to Try Now
item.description:
Korean beauty exploded onto the market a couple years ago (hello, bb cream!) and shows no signs of slowing down. Between the fun packaging, unique textures and (most importantly) glowing results, it provides the perfect marriage between form and function. Here are ten tried-and-true products that check all of the boxes.

Image credit: Glow Recipe

Lindsay Modeling Rubber Charcoal Mask

Lindsay Modeling Rubber Charcoal Mask

A treat for the senses, this rubbery mask starts as a powdery mix and morphs into moldable paste once you add water. Smooth the clarifying charcoal onto your face and peel it off after ten minutes to reveal softer, cleaner skin without the mess that comes with traditional masks.

$6; glowrecipe.com

Image credit: Sephora

Too Cool for School Egg Mousse Body Oil

Too Cool for School Egg Mousse Body Oil

Packed with super-hydrating oils like avocado and olive, this fluffy mousse melts the second you rub it in. All you’re left with is silky soft skin that doesn’t feel greasy or sticky in the slightest. It’s pretty much all we plan on using from now through September.

$25; sephora.com

Image credit: Glow Recipe

Blithe Patting Splash Mask in Yellow Citrus & Honey

Blithe Patting Splash Mask in Yellow Citrus & Honey

If you’re pressed for time (um, always), keep this bottle in your shower for a quick fix whenever your skin is looking dull. Just pour a capful into your palms and pat the formula onto your skin for 15 seconds before rinsing it off. Laced with lactic acid and botanical extracts, it quickly delivers a potent dose of exfoliating and softening ingredients to your skin.

 $45; glowrecipe.com  

RELATED: WE TRIED THIS MEGA Q-TIP EXFOLIATOR AND IT CHANGED OUR ENTIRE FACE

Image credit: Glow Recipe

J.One Jelly Pack

J.One Jelly Pack

A moisturizer and primer in one, this multitasker has a tacky texture upon initial application, but don’t let that put you off. As you pat it in, it melts into your skin and creates a smooth, even canvas for your makeup to adhere to. One or two pumps is all you need to keep your complexion fresh and dewy all day long.

$42; sephora.com

Image credit: Sephora

Chosungah 22 Dong Gong Minn Brow Maker

Chosungah 22 Dong Gong Minn Brow Maker

This magic wand delivers the soft definition of a brow powder with the ease of a pencil. Use the tapered end to fill in any bald spots or thinner areas--and the bristled bottom to sweep everything into place. (Even those abnormally long hairs that you always have to trim.) 

$22; sephora.com

Image credit: Birchbox

TONYMOLY Petite Bunny Gloss Bar

TONYMOLY Petite Bunny Gloss Bar

Tint and hydrate your lips with this adorable pocket-sized balm. Wear it alone for a subtle wash of color--or on top of your favorite lipstick for supple shine. The slim bullet is easy to maneuver so you can apply it on the go without having to worry about it getting everywhere. 

$8; sokoglam.com

Image credit: Amazon

Touch in Sol Stretchex Stretch Lash Effect Mascara

Touch in Sol Stretchex Stretch Lash Effect Mascara

This just might be the best mascara ever. It lengthens, darkens and curls lashes without so much as a clump thanks to the pigmented polymers in the formula and densely packed bristles of the brush. Plus, it has moisturizing silk proteins to keep lashes from drying out.

$22; sephora.com

RELATED: THE EASY TRICK FOR EXTENDING THE LIFE OF YOUR MASCARA

Image credit: Bloomingdales

AmorePacific Color Control Cushion Compact Broad Spectrum SPF 50+

AmorePacific Color Control Cushion Compact Broad Spectrum SPF 50+

With hydrating ingredients like bamboo sap and green tea--and a hefty SPF of 50--this multitasking makeup does it all. Using the enclosed sponge, press down on the cushion top to release the product before tapping it onto your face for dewy coverage. Though the $60 price tag is steep, it comes with a refill and fresh sponge so it lasts you twice as long. 

$60; bloomingdales.com

Image credit: Peach & Lily

Peripera Ah Much Real My Blusher

Peripera Ah Much Real My Blusher

And since we just waxed poetic about the many benefits of a cushion compact, might we also suggest a cushion blush? With a plush tip, you can easily blend color onto your cheeks without getting your fingers dirty--or having to use a brush. Plus, the vitamin E-enriched formula hydrates skin so you never get dry patches.


$16; peachandlily.com

Image credit: Peach & Lily

Mizon Correct Jelly Shadow

Mizon Correct Jelly Shadow

If you haven’t guessed by now, Korean beauty is all about cool textures that feel as good as they look. This bouncy eye shadow is no exception. Using your fingertip, pat or spread the color onto your lids for subtle definition and shimmer--or layer it on for a more dramatic look. Either way, it’s staying put all day without creasing or smudging.

$17; peachandlily.com

RELATED: THE BEST EYE SHADOW FOR YOUR EYE COLOR

item.title: Humans Now Have Shorter Attention Spans Than Goldfish
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

No disrespect to goldfish, but we’ve always fancied ourselves a more evolved species.

Well, the little guys have got us beat in at least one category: Attention span.

A new study by the Microsoft Corporation found that while the average attention span of a human is eight seconds, the average attention span of a goldfish is nine seconds.

What’s to blame? Smartphones, probably. In 2000, at the beginning of the mobile phone craze, the average human attention span was 12 seconds. Sixteen years later, our brains have become so over stimulated that we can’t even focus as long as the prize given out at kids’ birthday parties.

It’s not all bad, though. The same study found that our reliance on mobile technology has improved our ability to multitask.

In other words, while we might not be able to finish an episode of Game of Thrones without checking Instagram seven times, at least we now have the ability to do so without accidentally dropping our phone in the toilet. 

RELATED: 5 Easy Ways to Focus Better
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: How to Remove Every Single Type of Summer Stain
item.description:
You’re dining alfresco, enjoying a deliciously fresh Caprese salad (seasoned with olive oil, salt and pepper), when plop--a rogue heirloom tomato spills right into your lap. And you’re wearing white. We’ve got you covered with this handy guide for how to remove every single summer stain.

Element 1

1. Avocado. Scrape off any excess green before rinsing your garment in cold water. Next, pretreat by rubbing dish soap into the stain before you toss it in the wash.

2. Sweat. A stain remover applied to your pit stains before you wash your shirt or dress should do the trick. Don’t have a stain remover? Lemon juice also works.

RELATED: A Genius $1 Trick For Treating Sweat Stains

Element 2

3. Strawberries. Soak your shirt for 30 minutes in a mixture of water (one quart), white vinegar (one tablespoon) and liquid laundry detergent (1/2 teaspoon). Then, launder as usual.

4. Grass. These stains should actually come out on their own in the wash, but just in case: Pre-treat any green marks with stain remover and gently (we repeat: gently) scrub the stain before tossing it in the wash.

Element 3

5. Rosé. Blot the stain and add table salt to absorb any excess liquid. Next, give your shirt/dress/white jeans a rinse in hot water before machine washing as usual.

6. Ice Cream. Spot treat with cold water and a clean cloth right when the stain hits your shirt. (A Shout Wipe also works.) Then, apply stain remover before soaking it in the sink with a teaspoon of an enzyme-based detergent--like Tide Stain Release--for 30 minutes. After that, you’re good to machine wash.

Element 4

7. Tomatoes. Rinse with cold water before using a sponge and white vinegar to buff out any hint of color. If it’s still there, pre-treat with stain remover before sticking in the wash.

8. Sunscreen. Since sunscreen tends to be greasy, your best bet is to pre-treat it with a product that’s up for the job like dish soap (one that’s a clear color) or Lestoil. Dab it on with a clean cloth, then machine wash in hot water.

RELATED: A Quick Guide To Treating Every Single Type of Stain

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 5

9. Bicycle Grease. Speaking of grease, to remove stains left by chains on your bike, start by applying baby powder and blotting with a paper towel to remove any excess grease. Next, pre-treat stains with dish soap on the front and back of the stain. Then, throw the garment in the wash by itself.

10. Ketchup. Dab it with cold water right away, then sponge with white vinegar. Next, machine wash it using a color-safe detergent with bleach.

11. Mustard. Scrape off any excess mustard before pre-treating with a stain remover and sticking it in the washing machine on hot.

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 6

12. Popsicle. Start by giving the garment a soak in cold water, then spot treat with white vinegar (three parts water to one part vinegar is fine) before tossing in the wash.

RELATED: 10 Boozy Popsicle Recipes
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Guys, You Should Really Be Eating Your Strawberry Tops
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

For your entire life, you’ve probably been cutting off and throwing out your strawberry tops. (Us, too.) Turns out, though, they’re edible--and healthy.

See, wastefulness aside, strawberry leaves actually have some pretty cool healing properties. Namely, they’ve been proven to relieve gastrointestinal discomfort and joint pain. Plus, they taste not so bad--kinda like spinach or any leafy green.

Here, a few uses for these frequently discarded scraps.

Fruity Water. Use washed strawberry tops to infuse your water. The result: slightly sweet, refreshing strawberry-infused water with slightly more flavor than your typical cucumber and lemon water. 

Vinegar. Add some extra oomph to your summer salad by infusing basic vinegar with strawberries. Just crush strawberries in a sauce pan, add a high-quality white-wine vinegar and bring the mixture to a simmer. After about a minute, pour it into a jar, let it cool and then store it in your cupboard.

Smoothies. You put everything from leafy kale to celery in your morning drink. So why not add strawberry tops to the mix? Plop the whole berry in the blender to give your smoothie more texture and flavor.

Tea. Steep fresh or dried organic strawberry leaves in boiled water for a few minutes. Remove the leaves before drinking.

RELATED: Hey You! Don't Waste Your Carrot Tops
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 9 Adult Summer Camps Across the Country That Look Ridiculously Amazing
item.description:
Swimming in the lake, bunking in cabins with your besties and sneaking off to smooch with Timmy in the woods. Ahhh, those were the days...

Well, now you can relive your youth--but in much better style--with a wide variety of “adult summer camps” that offer everything from boozy color wars to archery. Here are nine awesome options for the throwback getaway you really want, but with the upscale accommodations you need. 

Image credit: Camp No Counselors

IF YOU WANT TO RE-ENACT "PARENT TRAP": CAMP NO COUNSELORS

IF YOU WANT TO RE-ENACT "PARENT TRAP": CAMP NO COUNSELORS

It’s time to take your Chicago city lifestyle farther afield. Every morning at Camp No Counselors (just a few hours from the Windy City) starts with Bloody Marys and mimosas. Then you’ll move on to weaving friendship bracelets, playing dodgeball and dancing until 2 a.m. at an ’80s-themed dance party. Sign up for the August 25 session before it sells out.

Image credit: Travaasa

IF YOU WANT THE BEST OF BOTH WORLDS: TRAVAASA-AUSTIN

IF YOU WANT THE BEST OF BOTH WORLDS: TRAVAASA-AUSTIN

With a pool this dreamy, it’s hard to imagine wanting to do anything else. And that’s OK. But for those Texans looking for a true summer camp adventure, it's got that, too. Hatchet throwing? Bull riding? Guided hikes? Sign us up.

Image credit: Club Getaway

IF YOU LIKE TO PLAY HARD: CLUB GETAWAY

IF YOU LIKE TO PLAY HARD: CLUB GETAWAY

Expect private (and air-conditioned) cabins at this Connecticut compound, plus endless amounts of surprisingly good food, free-flowing wine at dinner, nightly events and a serious list of daytime activities. Think zip-lining, tie-dyeing, trapeze lessons and color wars. Or just chill in a tube on the lake. 

Image credit: Moab Under Canvas

IF YOU'RE AN ADRENALINE JUNKIE: MOAB UNDER CANVAS

IF YOU'RE AN ADRENALINE JUNKIE: MOAB UNDER CANVAS

Not for the faint of heart, this four-day, three-night Utah experience packs in about as many heart-thumping thrills as you can think of--guided rock climbs, rafting the Colorado rapids, off-roading in the backcountry. You pick the dates and then an experienced guide will plan your action-packed itinerary. Warning: Tents are involved, but you choose whether it’s bare bones or the luxury-safari type.

RELATED: Secrets of Women Who Exercise Everyday

Image credit: Camp Grounded

IF YOU WANT TO GO OFF THE GRID: CAMP GROUNDED

IF YOU WANT TO GO OFF THE GRID: CAMP GROUNDED

This summer camp tucked deep into North Carolina’s Blue Ridge Mountains is all about unplugging. After you trade in your cell phones, computers and digital cameras, you’ll be ready for four days of old-fashioned fun. Think everything from yoga, sweat lodges and wellness teepees to color war, capture the flag and kickball. And at the end of the day, you can giggle yourself to sleep with your bunkmates in classic cabins. Registration is still open for August 19 to 22 and August 25 to 28.

Image credit: ZakMann/Courtesy of Soul Camp

IF YOU NEED TO ESCAPE THE CITY: SOUL CAMP

IF YOU NEED TO ESCAPE THE CITY: SOUL CAMP

Anyone who’s ever lived in Manhattan knows that sometimes you just need to get out of Dodge. That’s where Soul Camp New York (August 24 to 28) comes in. Only a few hours from the concrete jungle you call home is a serene camp nestled in the Adirondacks--and there’s even a special shuttle to take you there. Health-ified camp meals and good-for-you snacks like coconut water and kale chips will keep you energized for dance classes, boating on the lake and spiritual sessions crafting dreamcatchers. 

Image credit: Luke Beard

IF YOU'RE THE OUTDOORSY TYPE: COACHMAN CAMP

IF YOU'RE THE OUTDOORSY TYPE: COACHMAN CAMP

The newly opened design hotel in South Lake Tahoe gives cardio junkies easy access to all sorts of outdoor activities. Once you’ve had your fill of hiking, mountain biking and stand-up paddle boarding, post up at the hotel for happy hour and a game of cornhole. Then soak your tired muscles in the hot tub and end the day with s’mores by the firepit. Did we mention Saturday morning yoga on the beach? 

Image credit: Kylie Turley

IF YOU'RE AN AVID YOGI: WANDERLUST

IF YOU'RE AN AVID YOGI: WANDERLUST

Unlimited yoga classes by day, DJ dance parties by night. Wanderlust Aspen Snowmass (June 30 to July 3) promises everything from meditative sessions of sun salutations against mountain backdrops to body-bending acro-yoga from some of the best instructors around the country. Once you’ve downward-dogged yourself silly, throw on your tie-dye maxi and sway to the beats of Steel Pulse and Sol Rising. 

Image credit: Space Camp/Facebook

IF YOU'RE A NERD AT HEART: SPACE CAMP

IF YOU'RE A NERD AT HEART: SPACE CAMP

Fulfill all of your moonwalking fantasies at this two-night Alabama adult camp. Learn what it takes to be a real astronaut and then role-play top-secret space missions in actual astronaut simulators. Meals--they’ll have you on a strict diet of freeze-dried food, just kidding--and accommodations are included.

RELATED: 23 Little Pick-Me-Ups to Instantly Have a Better Day
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 8 Ways to Spend Less Money on Clothes
item.description:
Stocking up on new shirts, dresses and pants doesn’t mean you have to shell out the big bucks. Here are eight ways to upgrade your closet…and save.

Image credit: Twenty20

ORGANIZE A CLOTHING SWAP WITH FRIENDS

ORGANIZE A CLOTHING SWAP WITH FRIENDS

For the less-worn items in your closet, this is a fun way to get your friends together and walk away with some free fashion finds. (Because that hot-pink strapless number was fun, but you can wear it only so many times.) Ask friends to bring four to five pieces they’re willing to part with, open a bottle of rosé and go from there.

TAKE OLD ITEMS TO THE TAILOR

TAKE OLD ITEMS TO THE TAILOR

So, your trusty work sheath is suddenly sagging near your boobs? Don’t pass it off to Goodwill just yet. A tailor can work cost-effective wonders so that your dress (and a plethora of other items in your closet) will feel brand-new. 

RELATED: 7 Things You Should Take To The Tailor (And 4 Things You Shouldn’t)

RE-PURPOSE A BRIDESMAID DRESS

RE-PURPOSE A BRIDESMAID DRESS

Your now-married friend always told you: Yes, you will wear that floor-length number again. Which is actually a possibility if you have it hemmed and turned into a cute cocktail dress.

AVOID DRY-CLEAN-ONLY ITEMS

AVOID DRY-CLEAN-ONLY ITEMS

You spent $198 on a silk dress--but it costs you $15 every time you wear it. Next time, before you buy, peep the care instructions first. Depending on the item, you may decide that dry-clean only just isn’t worth the extra expense. 

Image credit: A Stylish Side Project

SUBSCRIBE TO RENT THE RUNWAY UNLIMITED

SUBSCRIBE TO RENT THE RUNWAY UNLIMITED

This pretty sweet service allows you to have your pick of everyday workwear (think: silk blouses, pencil skirts and handbags) for $139 a month. It works a lot like Netflix DVDs: Pick three items and keep each one for as little or as long as you’d like. Every time you send something back, you can replace it with something new. It basically pays for itself in (free) dry cleaning and shipping alone.

RELATED: Sweet! Companies Are Now Paying for Unlimited Rent the Runway

DON'T SKIP THE SHOPPING SURVEY

DON'T SKIP THE SHOPPING SURVEY

Nowadays, tons of stores--like the Gap--ask you to take a quick customer experience survey following a sale. (Details are typically included on your receipt.) Sure, it may take you an extra 15 minutes, but it typically earns you 10 to 15 percent off your next purchase. Not bad.

SUBSCRIBE TO STORE EMAILS (AND INSTAGRAM ACCOUNTS) FOR DEALS

SUBSCRIBE TO STORE EMAILS (AND INSTAGRAM ACCOUNTS) FOR DEALS

We know your email inbox is a sacred place. But this is where brands announce promotions--like 40 percent off at Ann Taylor--first.

PAY ATTENTION TO SEASONAL SALES

PAY ATTENTION TO SEASONAL SALES

Depending on the item you’re buying, there is a prime time to shop and score major discounts and deals. For example, shorts and tees are typically marked down in June, while sandals and swimsuits tend to go on sale in July and August. Trust us, a little shopping strategy goes a long way.

RELATED: The Best Times Of Year To Buy All Your Clothing (and Save)
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Yesss! A "Golden Girls" Restaurant Is Opening in NYC
item.description:
Quick, book a trip to New York City this September! A Golden Girls-themed restaurant is opening in Washington Heights--and yep, they’ll be serving cheesecake. And wine.

The new café is the brainchild of Michael J. LaRue, a close friend of late GG star Rue McClanahan (a.k.a. Blanche). DNAInfo reports that LaRue will pay tribute to our four favorite besties by displaying McClanahan’s memorabilia and other special items in the restaurant. 

In addition to wine and cheesecake (but seriously, are there any other foods?) the menu will include soups, wraps and baked treats. But the main attraction: The café will also feature live music, played on McClanahan’s piano. “Thank You for Being a Friend” sing-alongs? We’re so there.

RELATED: Dear Foodies: You Can Now Airbnb Julia Child’s House in Provence
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: PSA: Girl Scout Cookie Baking Mixes Are Now a Thing
item.description:
Image credit: The Washington Post/Getty Images

If you’re anything like us, you wait all year for Girl Scout Cookie Season and then mourn the the fact that you only ordered 12 boxes. (Is it really possible to run out so fast?)

Well, luckily you’ll never again have to live life without Thin Mints and Samoas.

That’s because Pillsbury is partnering with Girl Scouts of the USA to make new Girl Scout Cookies baking mixes. Think: the Pillsbury baked goods you already love, but in flavors like Thin Mints® Cupcake Mix and Caramel & Coconut Blondie Mix. All come together in about 30 minutes in your oven.

The only problem? The release of these heavenly mixes coincides with bathing suit season.

RELATED: 4 Girl Scout Cookie-Inspired Desserts That'll Save the Day When You Run Out
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: SJP Just Gave Us a Glimpse of Her New HBO Show and It Looks Amazing
item.description:
In case you missed it, Sarah Jessica Parker--aka the woman formerly known as Carrie Bradshaw--just announced on Instagram that her new HBO series Divorce (created by Catastrophe co-creator and star Sharon Horgan) will officially hit the small screen this fall. 

OK and we’re not even done there--she also included a totally adorbs teaser trailer featuring her and her soon-to-be-ex-on-screen-hubby Thomas Haden Church being funny and endearing and great. (Pssst…Molly Shannon also appears in the clip.) Consider this your official notice to save the date. 

RELATED: The 25 Best TV Shows Set in NYC, Ranked
