item.title: Aloe Ice Cubes Are a Summer Game Changer
item.description:
Image credit: Earth's Daughter

You were so good about slathering on sunscreen before your day at the beach--except for that teeny spot on the back of your leg that now feels like the center of the sun itself. Aloe cubes will save the day (the folks at Earth's Daughter tipped us off to this). Here’s how to make them.

What you need: A clean ice cube tray and aloe vera gel (we love the one from Jason).

What you do: Squeeze the gel into the tray so that each cube is about three-quarters of the way full. Then pop the tray in your freezer for a few hours.

Voilà! You now have at least 12 chilled, portable little remedies for all your summer hiccups.

RELATED: The Best Sunscreen Trick We’ve Learned This Summer
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: This Is What an Instagram "Like" Does to Your Brain
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

We’ve all “done it for the Insta,” but do you ever stop and wonder why seeing those accumulating likes feels so darn satisfying?

Well, there’s a legitimate answer, according to the Journal of Psychological Science. 

Researchers monitored the brain activity of a group of adolescents ages 13 to 18 as they scrolled through their Instagram feeds. What they found? That receiving likes on social media triggered the same pleasure centers in the brain that are stimulated by rewards like chocolate, money and sex.

In other words, your psychological response to receiving 100-plus likes on Instagram post is a lot like how you’d react to more primal pleasure stimuli--like shirtless Ryan Gosling on horseback handing you a delicious ice cream cone. 

On that note, we’d better get back to filtering our next post.

RELATED: The Ultimate Checklist for Not Being Annoying on Social Media
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Peony Jelly Is the Coolest Thing to Happen to Summer
item.description:
Image credit: Shawna Coronado

Aren’t pink peonies the best? But total sadness ensues the second we see them start to fade and wilt. Instead of throwing them out, salvage the petals and whip up a delicious peony jelly (you heard us) that’ll last all summer and beyond.

What you need: Four cups’ worth of peony petals (pluck ’em right before they turn brown), one lemon, three cups of sugar and one package of liquid pectin (or two tablespoons of powdered pectin)

What you do: Boil the petals in five cups of water, then let them steep overnight. Next, strain the water from the petals and add three tablespoons of freshly squeezed lemon juice to the liquid. (You can toss the petals at this point.) Bring it to a boil and add the sugar and pectin. Boil again for three minutes, then remove from the stove and let cool for a few hours. Voilà! Peony jelly.

But how does it look and taste? The color of the petals will influence the richness of the hue, but no matter what, it will be a subtle pink (as shown in this pic by blogger Shawna Coronado). And it tastes like a delicious combo of strawberry and peach jelly. Yum.

RELATED: The One-Minute Trick For Arranging Your Flowers Like a Pro
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: The 15 Best Barbecue Joints in America
item.description:
America may be a melting pot, but if there’s one food that we can truly call our own, it’s barbecue. (OK, fine, apple pie is pretty patriotic, too.) And we’re not just talking about throwing some burgers and dogs on the grill. We mean real meat, cooked low and slow over an open fire, and probably served with a pile of baked beans and mac and cheese. Every region has its own style, and everyone thinks they do it best. But who are we to discriminate? Here are our 15 favorites, from sea to smoky sea. 

RELATED: 21 Things All Foodies Need to Eat Before They Die

Image credit: @kristinshafel/Instagram

Joe's Kansas City Barbecue: Kansas City, KS

Joe's Kansas City Barbecue: Kansas City, KS

Kansas City is kind of like that annoying overachiever that does everything right--they’ve got great ribs, great brisket and pretty decent pork. And the tangy, molasses-tomato-based sauce is basically the gold standard for American barbecue sauce now. Come to Joe’s (or the artist formerly known as Oklahoma Joe’s) on the Kansas side of the city for the best of the best.

Image credit: @katiestew18/Instagram

Franklin BBQ: Austin, TX

Franklin BBQ: Austin, TX

You may have heard about the legendary (read: insane) line at Austin’s famed bastion of brisket, which regularly stretches to seven-hour waits. Owner Aaron Franklin, who has sold out of brisket every single day since he opened in 2009, plays no favorites--even Kanye West wasn’t allowed to cut.  So is it worth it? We think the line speaks for itself.

Image credit: @17thstreetbbq/Instagram

17th Street BBQ: Murphysboro, IL

17th Street BBQ: Murphysboro, IL

A favorite on the BBQ competition circuit (pitmaster Mike Mills has won “Memphis in May” three times, which basically makes him the Peyton Manning of meat smoking). You want the famous dry-rubbed baby back ribs. nbsp;

Image credit: @kkrader/Instagram

Big Bob Gibson Bar-B-Q: Decatur, AL

Big Bob Gibson Bar-B-Q: Decatur, AL

An Alabama hangout since 1925, Big Bob Gibson is known for his smoked birds--chicken and turkey--and his totally addictive creamy white sauce, which has inspired copycats all across the state.

Image credit: @kengoodmanphoto/Instagram

HOMETOWN BAR-B-QUE: BROOKLYN, NY

HOMETOWN BAR-B-QUE: BROOKLYN, NY

Great barbecue?  In New York City? No, this isn’t the next Pace Picante commercial. This Brooklyn newcomer really is cranking out some of the best, most innovative 'cue in the country. Come for the caveman-esque beef ribs, which fall off the bone in great, charred chunks. Stay for the lamb belly bánh mì and Jamaican jerk ribs. And make sure you’ve got at least one chunk of honey cornbread on your tray too. 

Image credit: @andrewthomaslee/Instagram

Skylight Inn BBQ: Ayden, NC

Skylight Inn BBQ: Ayden, NC

North Carolina is whole hog country, and Skylight Inn does it best. Just don’t expect a lot of fanfare--the hogs are smoked for 14 hours, then chopped, finished with a squirt of hot sauce and vinegar, and served with slaw. End of story.

Image credit: @savoryspiceshop/Instagram

Heirloom Market BBQ: Atlanta, GA

Heirloom Market BBQ: Atlanta, GA

We mostly stuck to traditional American barbecue, but with gochujang-marinated pork and kimchee slaw, this Korean-fusion spot is too good to pass up. The smoke brings out the funky, umami-rich chili paste, and the potato buns are studded with sesame, making for one of the best pulled-pork sandwiches around.

Image credit: @fashionrowe/Instagram

Allen & Son BBQ: Chapel Hill, NC

Allen & Son BBQ: Chapel Hill, NC

For classic North Carolina pulled pork, it’s hard to find anything better than this college town spot, which uses a 12-hour smoke process and spicy, vinegar-rich sauce.

Image credit: @newlifejosh/Instagram

The Joint: New Orleans, LA

The Joint: New Orleans, LA

Most people don’t go to New Orleans for the BBQ--it’s just hard to fit it in there with all the jambalaya and po’boys you also have to eat. But that would mean missing out on The Joint, and its chaurice sandwich. Chaurice is basically the Creole version of chorizo--and when added to The Joint’s already excellent pulled pork, it’s transcendent.

RELATED: 21 Things You Absolutely Must Eat When You’re In New Orleans

Image credit: @centralbbq/Instagram

Central BBQ: Memphis, TN

Central BBQ: Memphis, TN

If you’re in Memphis, you’re getting dry-rub ribs. But at Central, you’ll also want an order of the pulled-pork barbecue nachos, made with homemade chips. The downtown location is just far enough off the tourist track to be great, but close enough that you can still catch a blues show on Beale Street after dinner.

Image credit: @jackmasonbrand/Instagram

Black's BBQ: Lockhart, TX

Black's BBQ: Lockhart, TX

It’s true that Texas barbecue is all about the brisket--but one should never underestimate the smoked sausages either. Lockhart is pretty much the capital of the sausage scene, and nowhere does it better than Black’s. Pro tip: Start with the jalapeño-cheddar link.

Image credit: @austinfoodmagazine/Instagram

Kerlin BBQ: Austin, TX

Kerlin BBQ: Austin, TX

Author Johnny Fugitt spent a full year eating BBQ--365 restaurants in 365 days--for his book, The 100 Best Barbecue Restaurants in America. At the very top? A little low-key food truck in East Austin with some of the moistest, most flavorful brisket around. Make sure to get some blue cheese coleslaw on the side.

Image credit: @frenchieal/Instagram

MOONLITE BAR-B-Q INN: OWENSBORO, KY

MOONLITE BAR-B-Q INN: OWENSBORO, KY

Once you’ve had your fill of pulled pork, brisket and ribs (as if that were possible), and want something a little different, head over to western Kentucky, which is mutton-town. Yes, that means eating a sheep, but the long, slow cooking time takes away the toughness of the meat while leaving the same gamey flavor of a lamb chop.

Image credit: @ryanjohnsonnyc/Instagram

Pappy's Smokehouse: St. Louis, MO

Pappy's Smokehouse: St. Louis, MO

Not to be confused with the much sought-after bourbon (though we wouldn’t turn down that pairing), this Pappy’s is all about the ribs--as all good St. Louis barbecue should be.

Image credit: @thegranarysa/Instagram

The Granary 'Cue and Brew: San Antonio, TX

The Granary 'Cue and Brew: San Antonio, TX

Come at lunch for traditional, market-style barbecue, or at dinner for a more innovative (read: hipster) take on the classics. That means beef shoulder served with quinoa and tomato-caramel sauce and crispy smoked riblets with Thai dipping sauce.
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 9 Closet Organizing Hacks That'll Blow Your Mind
item.description:
Image credit: Design Love Fest

So what if they’re borderline OCD? These ten tricks will keep your closet in check so you never have to waste time looking for that missing sock--or earring--again.

RELATED: Creative Ways to Clean and Organize Your Space

Image credit: Design Love Fest

Element 1

Buy colored hangers
And assign them to different items in your closet. Like blue for jeans and white for blouses. Then rejoice at always finding what you're looking for.

Place an extra hook
In the front of your closet so you can easily plan your outfit for the next day--then hang it right where you can grab it.

Image credit: Better Homes and Gardens

Element 2

Get bins for your shoes
And put a photo on the outside of each one so you know what's inside.

Use letter organizers for your smaller purses and clutches
This will put them in order--and keep them upright so they don't lose their shape. 

Image credit: Hello Beauty

Element 3

Make your own accessories rack
Using a corkboard and decorative pushpins. Alternate the pins so you don't get the danglier items tangled.

And use an ice cube tray
To corral smaller items like earrings and rings.

Use a hanging shoe organizer
To store your socks and underwear instead of having them roll around your dresser drawer. 

Image credit: Remodelista

Element 4

Keep your linens in line
By tucking a sheet set inside one of its matching pillowcases. Then, stack them according to which room they'll be used in. 

Image credit: The Wonderist

Element 5

Use your suitcases
To store any out-of-season clothing items like those bulky wool sweaters.

RELATED: Your Biggest (and Smallest) Bathroom Conundrums, Solved
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Just in Time for July 4th Fireworks, There's Now Xanax for Dogs
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

If your pups are anything like ours, few things freak them out as much as fireworks...and thunder...and pretty much any loud, booming noise. 

That's why we were so psyched to read about Sileo, a new FDA-approved medication aimed at treating noise aversion in dogs. 

Sileo, which is prescribed by vets and administered by pet owners at home, calms dogs down without sedating them. So basically, it's kind of like canine Xanax. 

Because nothing should stop little Scooter from living his best life, regardless of the weather or day of the year. 

RELATED: Every Thought That Goes Through Your Dog's Head In a Day
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: There's a 400-Person Wait List For These Rosé Gummies...But You Can Make Your Own
item.description:
When we heard about Sugarfina's Rosé Gummy Bears, we were like, "Yes, please, we need them now."

When we heard about the 400-person wait list for Sugarfina's Rosé Gummy Bears, we were like, "No, thanks, ain't nobody got time for that."

So we're taking matters into our own hands and making them ourselves.

A few weeks ago we told you about Champagne gummy bears, a delightful treat that's super easy to make. To whip up a rosé version, all you need is a bottle of mid-grade rosé (don't waste the good stuff), gummy bears, a bowl and plastic wrap. In the bowl, submerge the gummies with the rosé, cover the bowl with the plastic wrap, let it sit overnight et voilà: You've got a DIY version of Sugarfina's hit--sans absurdly long wait list.

Good things come to those who don't wait. 

RELATED: 8 Summer Cocktails You Can Make With a Bottle of Rosé

item.title: Ooh! Your Next Lyft Ride Could Be in a "Ghostbusters" Ecto-1
item.description:
Image credit: Columbia Pictures

Who you gonna call? Apparently, Lyft. On July 1 and 2, the ride-sharing service is teaming up with Hollywood to help tease the July 15 release of the Ghostbusters reboot by offering Lyft users free rides around town in the official ghost-busting vehicle itself, the Ecto-1.

To request a ride, all you have to do is open up the app and select “Ghost Mode” and the actual Ecto-1 used in the film (or a replica) will appear--with minimal wait time, fingers crossed. You’ll also be entered for a chance to win tickets to the film’s L.A. premiere.

Participating cities include New York City, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Boston and Washington, D.C. Save the date.

item.title: 9 Sephora Perks You Didn't Know Existed
item.description:
Sephora is where you go to blow your paycheck replace your makeup, but there are so many ways you could be getting more bang for your buck. Here, nine benefits you need to take advantage of…now.

RELATED: 7 Amazon Prime Benefits You Might Not Know About

Image credit: The Krazy Coupon Lady

YOU CAN RETURN USED PRODUCTS WITH A RECEIPT

YOU CAN RETURN USED PRODUCTS WITH A RECEIPT

Like that foundation that dried out your skin after you used it for a week. Or that lipstick you wore on Saturday night that you hated when you saw it in pics. With a receipt, you’ll get your money back--no questions asked. (Without a receipt, you’ll get store credit, which is still pretty sweet considering that lipstick was used.)

Image credit: Vivianna Does Makeup

YOU GET FREE 2-DAY SHIPPING WITH SEPHORA FLASH

YOU GET FREE 2-DAY SHIPPING WITH SEPHORA FLASH

Think of it as Amazon Prime for your makeup. For a mere $10 a year, you get all the beauty products you buy delivered to your door within two days, free of charge (no minimum purchase required). Even better, if you need something overnight, Sephora Flash members can get it shipped for just $5.95.

Image credit: Beauty Kiss XO

SPEND $350 A YEAR AND YOU?LL GET EXTRA DISCOUNTS AND GIFTS

SPEND $350 A YEAR AND YOU'LL GET EXTRA DISCOUNTS AND GIFTS

Do the math and you might be surprised: That $50 foundation and $23 mascara that you replace five times a year earns you VIB (Very Important Beauty Insider) status. This grants you access to a number of Sephora perks--like surprise 10-percent-off coupons, free birthday gifts and invites to beauty classes (like how to perfect a smoky eye).

Image credit: Kevin Mazur/Getty Images

SPEND $1,000 A YEAR AND YOU COULD MEET JENNIFER ANISTON

SPEND $1,000 A YEAR AND YOU COULD MEET JENNIFER ANISTON

That high-powered hair dryer you splurged on pushed you over the $1,000 mark. This means that you’re not just VIB--you're VIB Rouge, which means you get even more perks like free gifts, free two-day shipping, unlimited free makeovers and--our personal fave--invites to primo in-store events (like the chance to meet Jennifer Aniston, who popped by an NYC store once to promote a fragrance).

Image credit: Twenty20

YOU?LL ALSO GET ACCESS TO YOUR VERY OWN BEAUTY CONCIERGE

YOU'LL ALSO GET ACCESS TO YOUR VERY OWN BEAUTY CONCIERGE

Just another VIB Rouge perk. Trust us, the option to dial direct and instantly reach an expert when you have a beauty problem you can’t solve is gold.

Image credit: Twenty20

MINI-MAKEOVERS ARE FREE

MINI MAKEOVERS ARE FREE

It’s pretty rare that going out warrants a full face of makeup. Sephora offers complimentary 15-minute services to all customers, regardless of VIB or VIB Rouge status. The trick is to insert the word “mini” when you make your request. Besides, all you’re really looking for is a bold lip…or eye. 

RELATED: Quiz: Should You Do A Statement Eye or a Statement Lip?

Image credit: Mat Hayward/Getty Images

A $50 PURCHASE GETS YOU A FULL MAKEOVER AT NO EXTRA CHARGE

A $50 PURCHASE GETS YOU A FULL MAKEOVER AT NO EXTRA CHARGE

If you know you have an event, call ahead and schedule a time for a CMA (Custom Makeup Application). You’ll probably spend close to that for a new lipstick, anyway--might as well get the extra bang for your buck.

Image credit: The Krazy Coupon Lady

YOU CAN GET UNLIMITED FREE SAMPLES

YOU CAN GET UNLIMITED FREE SAMPLES

Sure, you can return anything you don’t like--but you can also take a variety of products (foundation, moisturizer, even lipstick and eye shadow) for a test-drive before you buy. Just ask an employee for help--they'll package everything up, no questions asked.

Image credit: Angela Weiss/Getty Images

SHOPPING IN APRIL OR NOVEMBER GETS YOU 10 TO 20 PERCENT OFF

SHOPPING IN APRIL OR NOVEMBER GETS YOU 10 TO 20 PERCENT OFF

All hail the flash sale. At Sephora, the big ones happen twice a year. Proof you should really never buy anything full-price.

RELATED: The Best Times Of Year To Buy All Your Clothing (And Save)

item.title: Breaking News: Young, White Women Way More Likely to Groom Pubic Hair Than Anybody Else
item.description:
Image credit: HBO

This just in: A new study--the first of it’s kind, apparently--just confirmed that time and attention given to grooming, um, lady parts is on the rise, particularly for white women between the ages of 18 and 24.

The research--published in the journal JAMA Dermatology--found that after the age of 24, women were much less likely to invest time, money and pain in regular upkeep down there.

Young, white college-educated women, however, reported regularly shaving and waxing and cited "partner preference" as the biggest factor in their decision.

Um, aren’t you glad you’re old enough to do whatever the heck you want with your body? 

RELATED: Paid “Period Leave” Is Officially A Thing

item.title: 5 Easy Guacamole Recipes You'll Want to Make All Summer Long
item.description:
Image credit: PHOTO: LIZ ANDREW/STYLING: ERIN MCDOWELL

Guacamole is awesome. We'd eat it at every meal if we could--and some days we do (live your life!). Recently, we've been kicking things up a notch by adding in different ingredients besides the basics. Here, we present to you five irresistible, easy guacamole recipes. Grab some avocados and tortilla chips, and let's go.

RELATED: The Safest, Easiest Way Ever to Remove an Avocado Pit

Roasted Poblano and Corn Guacamole

Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and place 2 poblano peppers and 1 ear of corn (shucked) on it. Brush each vegetable with 1 teaspoon olive oil. Roast in a 450°F oven until lightly charred, 8 to 10 minutes. Cool to room temperature. Chop the poblanos and cut the corn off the cob. In a large bowl, mash 2 avocados with a fork. Stir in 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1 chopped red onion, 1 minced garlic clove and 1 cup chopped cilantro. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

2-Cheese Guacamole

In a large bowl, mash 2 avocados with a fork. Stir in ½ cup goat cheese, mashing it with the avocados. Add 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1 chopped sweet onion, 1 minced jalapeño, 1 cup chopped cilantro and 1 cup shredded Jack cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Sundried Tomato Guacamole

Chop 1 cup sun-dried tomatoes. In a large bowl, mash 2 avocados with a fork. Stir in 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 cup minced scallion, 1 minced garlic clove, ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper, ½ cup chopped basil and the sun-dried tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Bacon Guacamole

Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and arrange 6 pieces of bacon on it. Cook the bacon in a 400°F oven until crisp, 10 to 12 minutes, then let cool to room temperature. Chop the bacon. In a large bowl, mash 2 avocados with a fork. Stir in 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1 chopped red onion, 1 minced garlic clove, 1 teaspoon chile powder and 1 cup chopped cilantro. Crumble the bacon and mix it in. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Mango Guacamole

Peel and dice 1 mango. In a large bowl, mash 2 avocados with a fork. Stir in 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1 minced serrano chile, 1 cup minced scallion, 1 cup chopped parsley and ¼ cup chopped mint. Stir in the diced mango. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: This Genius Gadget Slices Watermelon Mess-Free
item.description:
Image credit: The Grommet

Ah, the dog days of summer are here, when all you want is an ice-cold beverage and crisp, refreshing fruit. Like watermelon. The only problem? No one wants to slice it up. The hacking! The juice! The sticky fingers!

No more, thanks to this cool kitchen tool that’s basically part knife, part tong. All you have to do is cut the watermelon in half and then use the gadget to slice and lift out perfectly sized pieces. The juice remains in the rind and your counter or picnic table stays clean.

As for the de-seeding…well, we can’t help with that.

item.title: 17 Things It's Perfectly OK to Lie About
item.description:
Image credit: Cirilopoeta/Getty Images

We all know lying is bad. But on the rare occasion, fibs help you from hurting someone close to you (namely, when that someone is you).

For example, it’s perfectly fine to lie when…

1. You’re not actually five minutes away. In fact you’re in your bed and haven’t even cracked a mirror yet.

2. You see an old acquaintance and agree that you should totally grab coffee and catch up. “OK, I’ll call you!!”

3. Your current coworker asks if you’re looking for another job (and you are). “Mmm, super happy. Yeah, really love this new open-concept floor plan.”

4. You’re rushing out the door and your friend can’t decide on an outfit and Yes, you look perfect. C’mon we’re so late.

5. You and your husband agreed to wait to watch the season finale of Game of Thrones together but you miiiight have snuck in a preview already.

6. Your boss asks if you want to see the 500 wedding photos she just got. “Want”--what an interesting word…

7. Your mother-in-law’s lasagna is more reminiscent of cardboard than heavenly carbs.

8. Your friend was a tad overserved last night and asks you how bad it was. It's probably for the best she dropped her phone in that pitcher of beer. 

9. Your friend’s makeup is vaguely clown-like…and it’s her wedding day. 

10. Anyone asks you how much you spent on anything. Whether it's a Chanel bag or Walmart jeans. 

11. Anyone asks you what your “number” is. Yes, we're talking about sex, but this also applies to pizza slices.

12. You definitely didn't read the 15-page New Yorker piece on the parallels between the American presidential election and the Brexit. "But ah yes, that's a fascinating point indeed." 

13. Your friend’s friend invites you to karaoke. Singing Katy Perry with virtual strangers: Nope. 

14. Your friend invites you to karaoke. Singing Katy Perry with people you actually like: Still nope. 

15. Someone kindly gives you a gift but you would never have chosen it for yourself. "I've just never thought to try a fedora!"

16. You get pulled over and the officer asks if you know what you did. Cue the suuuuper genuine crocodile tears.

17. You have a secret stash of emergency chocolate that your kids cannot find out about.Because sometimes mom just needs three Kit Kats in a dark pantry. 

RELATED: How to Get Out Of Awkward Situations
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

Slice it thin and pair it with fruit--it’s pretty much the best summer snack ever.

3. Cheddar

3. Cheddar

The sharper the better. Especially on BECs.

Image credit: Young Sok Yun/Flickr

2. Mozzarella

2. Mozzarella

Somewhere between slice two and slice three is our happy place.

Image credit: OneTallChef/Flickr

1. Burrata

Hands down, the best food in the universe. Now if you’ll excuse us, we have some night cheese to work on.

item.title: Oh, Cool: Your Fitbit Now Tells You the Best Time to Go to Sleep
item.description:
Image credit: @fitbit

Ordering food, outsourcing laundry, booking a nail appointment…there is an app for pretty much everything. And now, there’s one to make sure that you get enough sleep each night.

Fitbit, the maker of those trendy fitness-tracking devices, recently rolled out a new feature in its app that creates a customized sleep schedule for you. All you need to do is wear your Fitbit to bed.

Most Fitbit devices (except for the Zip) already track your sleep--more specifically, how much you sleep. But with the new Sleep Schedule feature, it will take that data and use it to give you suggestions on the optimal amount of sleep you need daily and offer bedtimes and wake-up times to ensure that you reach those goals. Plus, there’s no need to set an alarm anymore. The device will gently vibrate when it’s time to rise and shine.

RELATED: 7 Ways to Actually Get 8 Hours of Sleep
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: The 3 Things You Should Always (Always) Buy in Bulk
item.description:
Buying in bulk is great: It’s often cost-effective and means you’re probably not faced with an empty roll of toilet paper at 4 a.m. But buying in bulk requires a little strategy, since you don’t want to be stuck with five gallons of milk that expire in two weeks. Here, three categories of items that you should always buy in bulk.

RELATED: 6 Ways to Score Shopping Deals with You Left All Your Coupons at Home

Image credit: Twenty20

Stuff that you'll always need

Stuff that you'll always need

According to US News and World Report, buying toilet paper in bulk can be up to 50 percent cheaper than buying a roll here and there. Toilet paper, like pet food and lightbulbs, is something that you’re always going to need, no matter what. As long as you have storage space, it pays to stock up in bulk.

RELATED: 6 Costco Benefits You Probably Didn't Know About

Image credit: Twenty20

Stuff that's easy to store

Stuff that's easy to store

Maybe you don’t have closet space for dozens of rolls of toilet paper, but other household items like garbage bags, toothpaste and toothbrushes (which should be replaced every three months) are compact enough to store just about anywhere.

Image credit: Twenty20

Stuff that won't go bad

Stuff that won't go bad

Nonperishable pantry staples like oats, beans, pasta and rice are great for buying in bulk, since you don’t have to worry about using them quickly. While not a food item, per se, alcohol also fits in this category since, with the exception of open bottles of wine, it typically has a long shelf life and can be purchased in larger quantities for less money. And let’s face it: We’ll use it.

RELATED: 7 Fast Food Apps That Reward You with Free Food
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: The Best Beach in Every Single U.S. State
item.description:
Image credit: Simon/Flickr

As they say, life’s a beach…and when it comes to sweltering hot summer weather, there’s nowhere we’d rather be. Here, the best beach (by which we mean “stretch of shoreline against idyllic water”) in every U.S. state.

RELATED: The Ultimate Beach Vacation Bucket List

Image credit: John Tuggle/Flickr

Alabama

Alabama: Gulf Shores Public Beach
Families flock to Alabama’s Gulf Shores, just an hour south of Mobile, to escape the heat of Bama summer. This public, white sand beach offers activity for the whole clan, from volleyball and boarding to deep sea fishing tours.

Image credit: David Ellis/Flickr

Element 8

Alaska: Black Sand Beach
OK, you probably didn’t travel to Alaska to swim. But this stunning black sand beach with sweeping glacier views in Prince William Sound is a popular spot for kayaking and simply taking in the view.

Arizona: Lake Havasu State Park
On Arizona’s west coast you’ll find Lake Havasu’s famed hidden coves. The most popular spot is “The Sandbar,” where families gather to wade in the ankle-deep water.

Arkansas: Norfok Lake Beaches
Norfok Lake, in the Ozark Mountains, is known for quiet crowds, sloping shores and naturally white “sugar sands.”

RELATED: The Best Lake Towns in America

Image credit: SDDirk/Flickr

Element 2

California: Coronado Beach

The 1.5-mile stretch of sand just across the bay from San Diego sparkles in the California sunshine and is blessed with Mediterranean-like weather. The water is ideal for surfing and swimming.

Image credit: Great Sand Dunes NPP/Flickr

Element 31

Colorado: Medano Creek
Each spring, Medano Creek in Great Sand Dunes National Park fills with water flowing from the Sangre De Cristo Mountains, perfect for activities like skim boarding and tubing. But act fast; come August, the creek dries up until the next year.

Connecticut: Ocean Beach
This might be the most family-friendly summer spot in all of New England. Think raucous boardwalk, public pool and mini-golf courses galore.

Delaware: Rehoboth Beach
Set in a quintessential beach town with an old-fashioned feel, Rehoboth is peaceful and clean yet active and amenity-laden (and a far cry from party-heavy nearby Dewey).

Image credit: Jeffrey Pott/Flickr

Element 29

Florida: Siesta Beach
This barrier island set between Roberts Bay and the Gulf of Mexico is home to three popular beaches. The best, Siesta Beach, boasts turquoise waters and quartz sand. 

Georgia: Sea Camp Beach
Just north of the Florida state line sits Sea Camp, one of two beaches on Cumberland Island National Seashore known for its pristine marshes and roaming wild horses.

RELATED: 8 Island Vacations You Can Take Without Leaving the Country

Image credit: Brian Hancock/Flickr

Element 5

Hawaii: Lanikai Beach
Choosing the best beach in Hawaii is no small feat, but we’ll give it a go. Located in Oahu, Lanikai means “heavenly sea,” and it's easy to see why thanks to crystal blue water, soft sand, coral reefs and a protected lagoon that’s basically a swimmer’s paradise.

Idaho: Bear Lake State Park
Bear Lake, set on the border of Idaho and Utah, is known as “The Caribbean of the Rockies” for its gleaming turquoise waters. On the northern and eastern shores you’ll find the state park, a popular spot for water sports and camping.

Image credit: Shutter Runner/Flickr

Element 6

Illinois: Oak Street Beach
Who says you can’t find tranquility in the middle of the city? Just steps from Chicago’s Michigan Avenue, Oak Street Beach is surrounded by bars and restaurants, a running and biking path and a panoramic view of the downtown skyscrapers.

Image credit: Joey Lax-Salinas/Flickr

Element 15

Indiana: Indiana Dunes State Park
That said, if you do want a respite from Chicago, head to this state park about an hour east of the city. Here, the rugged dunes, quiet hiking trails and tranquil shores are the perfect counter to a bustling urban lifestyle.

Iowa: Lake Red Rock
Hello, classic lake vacation. Cabin rentals surround this reservoir on the Des Moines River. Outdoor activities are endless, but the real reason to come is for the fishing. Rent a boat for the day and cast a line for bluegill, crappie and bass.

Kansas: Lake Scott
This freshwater lake is surrounded by the Ogallala rock formation, making it one of the most interesting landscapes in a state known for, well, flatness.

Kentucky: Barren River Lake
Sure, this state park in south-central Kentucky offers great swimming, but it’s best known for fishing. During the daytime, locals cast their lines off the marina to catch local bass, bluegill and catfish--then by night they camp out and cook their haul.

Louisiana: Rutherford Beach
Along Louisiana’s 26 miles of Gulf Coast beaches, Rutherford stands out for its shallow waters and undeveloped shoreline dotted with beach comb trees, driftwood and seashells.

Image credit: Abhishek Srivastava/Flickr

Element 23

 

Maine: Sand Beach
Sunbathers, this one’s for you. The water in this stunning cove on the Atlantic Ocean hardly ever rises above 60 degrees, even in the warmest summer months. In other words, you probably don’t want to venture in the water.

Image credit: Meghan Hess/Flickr

Element 48

Maryland: South Ocean Beach
This unspoiled beach on Assateague Island feels like a throwback to another era: The landscape is rugged, the buildings are scarce and wild ponies wander from the forest to the shores.

Massachusetts: Cisco Beach
Many of Nantucket’s beaches are overcrowded with summer jet-setters, but not Cisco, the widest spot on the island. On your way, stop by nearby Bartlett's Farm to pack a lobster roll picnic lunch.

Image credit: Josh Kellogg/Flickr

Element 30

Michigan: Glen Haven Beach
You’ll find a handful of beaches along the coastline of Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lake Shore, but none quite like Glen Haven, known for windswept dunes, turquoise water and quaint, nearby fishing villages.

Minnesota: Lake Nokomis Main Beach
There’s no shortage of swimming holes in the state dubbed "Land of 10,000 Lakes" but this one in Minneapolis has it all: Canoes and kayaks for rent, running and biking paths galore and calm water perfect for swimming.

Image credit: MARK RALSTON /Getty Images

Element 39

Mississippi: Long Beach
Long Beach, located along Mississippi’s 26 miles of Gulf Coast, is a laid-back, Southern getaway just west of the popular vacation town Biloxi. Families bike to the public beach with picnic baskets and colorful kites in hand.

Missouri: Osage Beach
Lake of the Ozarks National Park has lots of beaches, but this lively enclave stands out. Home to the renowned “party cove,” Osage is a haven for rowdy boaters looking to drink, swim and otherwise get down.

Image credit: Cocoabiscuit/Flickr

Element 24

Montana: City Beach
Along a seven-mile glacial lake in Whitefish sits the picturesque City Beach. With a roped-off swimming area, day boat rentals, lifeguards on duty, gazebos and picnic tables, it’s the perfect escape for the whole fam.

Nebraska: Lake McConaughy
This reservoir on the North Platte River is seriously awesome if you’re into water sports. (Think: sailboating, waterskiing and scuba diving.)

Image credit: Don Graham/Flickr

Element 27

Nevada: Sand Harbor
On the east side of Lake Tahoe, Sand Harbor is a jewel in the Sierra Nevadas, thanks to glistening water surrounded by round boulders and a stunning view of the distant snowcapped mountains.

New Hampshire: Hampton Beach
This state park, an hour north of Boston, is a New England favorite. Think: sandy dunes, an active boardwalk
and sweeping shores along the pristine Atlantic Ocean. It also boasts an annual sand sculpture contest and fireworks every Wednesday night throughout the summer.

Image credit: Kenneth Canning/Getty Images

New Jersey: Cove Beach
Of all the beaches that make up Cape May’s shore, Cove Beach is definitely the best. When you need a break from the sun, climb to the top of the famous Cape May Lighthouse for a panoramic view of the peninsula.

New Mexico: Cochiti Lake
Cool off from the hot, arid weather at Cochiti Lake, a manmade beach on the Río Grande between Albuquerque and Santa Fe--and a total hot spot for camping and barbecuing.

New York: Ditch Plains Beach
This refreshingly laid-back enclave in Montauk is a far cry from the glitzy beaches of East Hampton. Come for the iconic lighthouse and scenic cliffs. Stay for the stellar surfing and a pressed sandwich from Ditch Witch food truck.

RELATED: The Best Vacation Spot in Every State

Image credit: Jim Dollar/Flickr

Element 26

North Carolina: Cape Hatteras National Seashore
This barrier island stretches for about 70 miles on Carolina’s outer banks. The coast is lined with picturesque sandy dunes and ends at the lovely Bodie lighthouse.

North Dakota: Lake Renwick
Head to Icelandic State Park to relax on this mile-long sandy beach with a designated swimming area and adorable cabins for rent.

Ohio: East Harbor State Park
Set on the shores of Lake Erie, East Harbor State Park in Marblehead is a popular spot for boating, camping and swimming throughout the summer months. The lake is perfect for children since the water stays shallow far beyond the shoreline.

Oklahoma: Keystone State Park
Calling all teetotalers. Keystone Lake, found on the Arkansas River just 15 miles from Tulsa, contains three alcohol-free beaches. The most popular, Keystone State Park is great for families or couples looking for a low-key getaway.

Image credit: Chedder/Flickr

Element 45

Oregon: Cannon Beach
On Oregon’s northern coast, about 80 miles from Portland, stretches romantic Cannon Beach. Its most notable feature is the 235-foot Haystack Rock rising out of the water.

Pennsylvania: Presque Isle State Park
This sandy peninsula that extends into Lake Erie contains about a dozen small and secluded beaches that open between Memorial Day and Labor Day.

Rhode Island: Fred Benson Town Beach
Fred Benson Town Beach, or Crescent Beach, as the locals call it, is the most spectacular part of Block Island’s 17-mile coastline. With lifeguards on duty and cabanas, umbrellas and boogie boards for rent, it’s one of New England’s best summer spots. 

Image credit: Herbus Maximus/Flickr

Element 36

South Carolina: Kiawah Beachwalker Park
This windswept haven is only a short drive from Charleston, but feels a world away. Plus, while most beaches on Kiawah Island are private and accessible only if you’re staying at a resort this one is open to any and everyone.

South Dakota: Angostura Reservoir
This lake in the southern Black Hills is known for crystal-clear waters and 36 miles of flat, sandy coastline.

Image credit: Denise Mattox/Flickr

Element 17

Tennessee: Percy Priest Lake Swimming Beach
Its convenient location, just ten miles from downtown Nashville, makes Percy Priest Lake a popular summer escape. Kayak to Luau Island, a secret spot in the middle, for a picnic lunch. Or if you’re a daredevil, try cliff jumping from the towering rocks. 

Texas: Malaquite Beach
Unlike the beaches of South Padre Island, which are filled with rowdy spring breakers, Malaquite Beach on North Padre Island is rarely crowded. Visit during nesting season, from April to July, and you could see hundreds of baby sea turtles break out from the sand and run toward the sea.

RELATED: The 7 Best Swimming Holes in America

Image credit: Mladen Antonov/Getty Images

Element 7

Utah: Wahweap Marina
One of the most popular swimming areas in Lake Powell, Wahweap Marina boasts cobalt blue waters surrounded by luminescent red stone.

Vermont: Sand Bar State Park
Vermont has a handful of picturesque beaches on the shore of Lake Champlain, but most have awfully rocky terrains. The beach at Sand Bar State Park in Milton, however, is sandy, shallow and great for kids.

Virginia: Chincoteague Island Shoreline
Chincoteague, a small barrier island off Virginia’s coast, is known for its oyster beds, clam shoals and 14,000-acre National Wildlife Refuge. You won’t find any boardwalks, beaches or crowds--just miles of sprawling, clean coastline.

Image credit: Zebidiah Andrews/Flickr

Washington: Ruby Beach
A popular spot along the southern coastline of Olympic National Park, Ruby Beach is known for its picturesque sea stacks and shores lined with driftwood. When the sun goes down, campers pitch tents and light fires on the sand.

West Virginia: Summersville Beach
Sandstone cliffs, clean water and about 60 miles of shoreline are what you’ll find at West Virginia’s largest lake. Summersville Beach is also situated right on the dam of the Gauley River, home to some of the country’s best white-water rafting.

Image credit: Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources/Flickr

Element 40

Wisconsin: Big Bay State Park
This 1.5-mile expanse of sandy shoreline on Madeline Island, the largest on Wisconsin’s 22 Apostle Islands, offers gorgeous views of Lake Superior and a rugged backdrop of sandstone bluffs.

Wyoming: Firehole River Swimming Area
When you think of Yellowstone, you probably think of geysers and hot springs. But America’s favorite national park has some awesome swimming holes, too. We love Firehole River, a deep pool surrounded by indigenous rock.

RELATED: The Best Beaches in America, Ranked

item.title: Rejoice! Butter Isn't Terrible For You, According to Science
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Good news for butter-lovers: A new study out of Tufts University in Boston just confirmed that the creamy condiment--which up to this point has gotten a bad rap thanks to it’s saturated fat content--isn’t actually terrible for your health.

After examining a series of recent research, study authors concluded that spreading real butter on toast, corn on the cob or cacio e pepe isn’t linked to chronic illnesses (like heart disease) as people originally thought. In fact, it might even help protect against type 2 diabetes.

Sadly, this still doesn’t mean you should start eating it by the stick. (Researchers found that, from a nutritional standpoint, butter is a “middle of the road” food--aka it’s better than sugar, but worse than olive oil.) But as long as we can consume full-fat butter, everything in moderation is a rule we think we can abide. 

RELATED: The 10 Rules of Butter
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Here's Why the Oscars Might Be (Refreshingly) Different Next Year
item.description:
Image credit: Dan MacMedan/Getty Images

Remember that whole #OscarsSoWhite fiasco earlier this year? Oh yeah, and the year before that? Well, the Academy of Motion Pictures is finally taking a stand by inviting its most diverse voting class ever: 46 percent of the new inductees are female and 41 percent are people of color. Now, this will only bring up the overall totals to 27 percent and 11 percent respectively... But it's a start.

The invitees include: America Ferrera, Vivica A. Fox, Eva Mendes, Gabrielle Union, Nia Long, Freida Pinto, Idris Elba, Anthony Anderson, Michael B. Jordan, John Boyega, Marlon Wayans and O'Shea "Ice Cube" Jackson, among 671 others (as a whole). Cheers to change!

item.title: A Brilliant Little Trick for Fixing Manicure Mistakes
item.description:
Image credit: Getty Images

So, you were never one of those kids who could color within the lines. And now, as a full-grown adult, painting your nails is no different. But hey, that’s what polish remover and pointy Q-tips are for, right? Well, sort of.

Next time you get polish on your skin (so pretty much every time you paint them): Take a pointy Q-tip and dip it in some rubbing alcohol instead.

Most polish removers have acetone in them--which melts the pigment and stains the surrounding skin--whereas rubbing alcohol just tackles the polish without breaking it down. Now if only we could get them to stop chipping.

RELATED: A Foolproof Guide to DIY Manis
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: How to Baste Food Without a Basting Brush
item.description:
Image credit: Rocks Under Water/Getty Images

Corn? Check. Marinade? Check. Steaks? Check. Basting brush to slather said marinade on steak? Oh, crap. Luckily, you can get by without one.

What you need: Corn cobs and a rubber band.

What you do: Peel the husks off the cobs as you normally would. Only instead of tossing them into the trash, grab a fistful and tie them off with a rubber band. Gently pull apart the loose husks at the opposite end so they’re splayed. There you have it: Nature’s basting brush.

Don’t have corn? You can get a similar effect using the stringy ends of green onions.

RELATED: The Best BBQ Recipes That Take 30 Minutes or Less

item.title: Dream Job Alert: There Are People Who Get Paid to Watch Netflix
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Listen, you might love your job. You might even think it’s the best job. And while we’re sure you’ve got a great thing going, we can say with just about complete certainty that it’s not truly the best. 

That’s because there are people whose job is to watch Netflix. They win.

“Juicers,” as they’re known, watch some of Netflix’s 4,000-plus titles and choose the best still images and short video clips to represent said title to help other users figure out what to watch. For their binge-watching efforts, they’re paid $10 per film or show.

But before you get too jealous, know that it’s not all fun and games. Since juicers are technically independent contractors, they aren’t eligible for overtime or health benefits, and as a result, a few of them are suing Netflix. 

But legal issues aside, just imagine your day at the office entailing settling into an entire season of 30 Rock, because that sounds like our version of the American dream.

RELATED: 18 Summer TV Shows You Need to Watch
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Why You Should Really Be Freezing Your Coffee Beans
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Coffee snobs, listen up. If you grind your own joe, you should really be freezing your beans. Here’s why:

As you may or may not have noticed, coffee beans aren’t all the same size. When you grind them, the small grains taste slightly sour and big grains taste bitter. But storing your beans at a cold temperature keeps them consistently sized, and as result, your finished brew will have a more even flavor.

By contrast, if you store coffee beans at room temperature, they’re more likely to be inconsistently sized when ground. They can also absorb flavors and smells from the air--like that bacon you made earlier…or the new perfume you’re going a little heavy on.

Moral of the story: Cold beans make for a better brew.

RELATED: How to Make the Best Iced Coffee
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Being "That Person" Who Takes Food Photos Will Actually Make You Happier
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Instagram guilt is real. (Hello, you should be living in the moment!) But according to a new study, pausing what you’re doing to snap a pic will actually make you more engaged in the experience.

The research--published in the Journal of Personality and Social Psychology--explains that taking photos actually boosts your enjoyment of positive situations (like that delicious dinner or epic sunset.) This is because the very act of snapping a pic directs extra visual attention to what you’re doing, which heightens the moment so you appreciate it even more. 

There is one exception: The key is to take the photo and move on. Spending the following 19 minutes choosing the perfect filter will interfere with the experience and negate the joy, according to researchers.

So, go ahead--take a bunch of pics. Then put your phone away.

RELATED: 6 Ways To Take Better Pictures On Your Phone
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: How to Keep Your Nails Looking Nice Without a Manicure
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Maybe your nails are at a breaking point from getting back-to-back gels. Or maybe you’re strapped for cash and time. Whatever your reason, taking a break from manicures means less hassle, yes, but not less maintenance. Here are seven tips for keeping your digits primed and polished--figuratively, that is.

RELATED: The Real Reason Your Nails Keep Splitting

Image credit: Twenty20

Eat more eggs

Eat more eggs
And chicken and fish and beef. Basically up your protein intake altogether to give brittle or weakened nails a strengthening boost.

Image credit: Twenty20

Make them brighter

Make them brighter
Mix together a tablespoon of baking soda and a generous squeeze of lemon juice. Gently scrub the paste onto your nail beds with a toothbrush, let it sit for a few minutes and rinse to reveal whiter tips.

Keep them short and round
So they’re less likely to snag (which is often the case with squared-off shapes) or break (which happens when they’re longer). After clipping them to your desired length, file from either side of the nail toward the center--rather than sawing back and forth across the entire tip of the nail, which weakens them.

Use the right tools
Get thee a four-sided nail buffer, which has a different surface of varying grit on each side. All of the sides are marked in the order of how you should use them, so follow accordingly for a smooth, shiny finish. Note: You’ll probably be tempted to bust out your buffer daily (it makes your tips super glossy), but don’t use it more than once a week as too much buffing can thin out your nails.

RELATED: The Coolest Way to Mend a Broken Nail

Image credit: Twenty20

Limit water exposure

Limit water exposure
Water is usually a good thing--especially when it comes to staying hydrated. But water on your hands is actually very drying to the nails and cuticles. Limit exposure by wearing gloves during household chores like washing the dishes, and if you’re taking a bath, make sure to keep your hands out of the tub.

But soak them in oil often
Dip your fingertips into a small bowl of olive oil, making sure to cover the entire nail and cuticle area. Let them soak for ten minutes (now is the time to listen to a short podcast and massage the remaining oil in before sealing everything off with hand cream.

Image credit: Zoya

And if you still miss polish

And if you still miss polish
Try topping off your nails with a lightly tinted nail treatment instead. It will neutralize any discoloration and help disguise any bumps or ridges without the harsh chemicals that are in many polishes.

RELATED: 7 Things That Might Happen If You Stop Getting Manicures
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: The 19 Best Cookies in America
item.description:
Image credit: Fluff Bake Bar

Let’s face it: We need a new dessert trend. Cupcakes are sooo Sex and the City circa 2002.  And even the Cronut line is dying down (sometimes). For our new favorite sweet treats, we’re going to make a case for the underdog: the deceptively humble and all-too-overlooked cookie. Sure, they can be simple, but there are also plenty of complex flavors out there. And either way,  nothing is better with a cold glass of milk during the mid-afternoon doldrums. 

RELATED: 21 Things All Foodies Need to Eat Before They Die

Image credit: @flourbakeryandcafe

Homemade Oreo: Flour, Boston, MA

1. Homemade Oreo: Flour, Boston, MA

It’s hard to imagine anything actually improving an Oreo. But Boston’s spectacular Flour bakery manages to do just that. Its version is part whoopie pie: soft and squishy, with a variety of flavored creams on the inside (we especially like the Matcha Green Tea).

Image credit: @wakeandbite/instagram

Compost Cookie: Momofuku Milk Bar, New York, NY

2. Compost Cookie: Momofuku Milk Bar, New York, NY

When it comes to desserts, Momofuku’s pastry chef Christina Tosi definitely takes an everything-but-the-kitchen-sink approach. The compost cookie has chocolate and butterscotch chips, graham cracker crumbs, oats, potato chips, pretzels and even coffee grounds. And somehow it all works.

Image credit: @angiehanna/Instagram

Ranger Cookie: Sweet Mandy B's, Chicago, IL

3. Ranger Cookie: Sweet Mandy B's, Chicago, IL

The Ranger Cookie--a favorite with the Chicago stroller set--is all about texture. Big and pleasingly lumpy, it’s filled with oats, walnuts, chocolate chips and Rice Krispies. 

Image credit: Batter Bakery

Chocolate Mint Cookie: Batter Bakery, San Francisco, CA

4. Chocolate Mint Cookie: Batter Bakery, San Francisco, CA

Mint-flavored desserts can be tricky: When things go awry, they taste an awful lot like toothpaste. Not so at this beloved San Francisco kiosk, run by a former accountant who quit her job to bake all day (life goals). Her cookies are deeply chocolately, with just a hint of minty freshness.   

RELATED: 22 Things You Can’t Leave San Francisco Without Eating

Image credit: @Smcgee/Instagram

Coconut Macaroons: Salty Tart, Minneapolis, MN

5. Coconut Macaroons: Salty Tart, Minneapolis, MN

Reminder: In the great world of cookies, there are macarons (colorful merengue sandwiches usually found in Paris) and macaroons (delightful mounds of toasted coconut). No one does the latter better than the Salty Tart, which uses real vanilla beans and tapioca syrup. Bonus: They’re gluten-free! 

Image credit: Lovejoy Bakers

Ginger Molasses: Lovejoy, Portland, OR

6. Ginger Molasses: Lovejoy, Portland, OR

With floor-to-ceiling windows, this Portland bakery is unfailingly pleasant--especially with a cup of tea and a chewy, spicy Ginger Molasses cookie in hand.

Image credit: @secondhelpings/Instagram

Chocolate Chip Cookie: Petrossian Boutique and Café, New York, NY

7. Chocolate Chip Cookie: Petrossian Boutique and Café, New York, NY

There are no bells and whistles or fancy ingredients here. It’s simply the perfect version of a perfect food: crispy edges; soft, buttery middle; and a scattering of dark chocolate discs to ensure ideal chip-to-batter ratio.

RELATED: Chocolate Chip Cookie For One

Image credit: Pondicheri Bake Lab

Chocolate Chili Cookies: Pondicheri Bake Lab, Houston, TX

8. Chocolate Chili Cookies: Pondicheri Bake Lab, Houston, TX

Located above a beloved Indian restaurant, this bakery infuses its treats with South Asian spices--there’s cardamom in the madeleines, and a rich, chai-custard pie. We love the chocolate-chili cookies, which are basically oatmeal-chocolate-chip cookies with a major kick of extra flavor. 

Image credit: @infatuation_dc/Instagram

Peanut Butter Sin-Wich Sandwich Cookie: Baked & Wired, Washintgon, DC

9. Peanut Butter Sin-Wich Sandwich Cookie: BAKED & WIRED, WASHINGTON, D.C.

Skip the lines at Georgetown Cupcakes and head around the corner to this local favorite. You can’t go wrong with anything on the menu, but our favorite is the Peanut Butter Sin-Wich, which is like a Reese’s in cookie form.

Image credit: Scotty C./Yelp

Gingerbread Cookie: Sugar Bakeshop, Charleston, SC

10. Gingerbread Cookie: Sugar Bakeshop, Charleston, SC

Sugar is best known for its gorgeous, made-to-order layer cakes. But its cookies are not to be overlooked. We love the spicy gingerbread, which is basically Christmas in a bite.

Image credit: @tartinebakery/Instagram

Salted Chocolate Rye Cookie: Tartine, San Francisco, CA

11. Salted Chocolate Rye Cookie: Tartine, San Francisco, CA

San Francisco’s Tartine can do no wrong. Putting whole-grain rye flour in its chocolate cookies--a move we never would have ordinarily endorsed--somehow gives them exactly the right texture: dense and fudgy, with a complex chocolate flavor.

Image credit: @meganrosteen/Instagram

Dark Chocolate Lavender Macarons: Bakery Lorraine, San Antonio, TX

12. Dark Chocolate Lavender Macarons: Bakery Lorraine, San Antonio, TX

The owners of this San Antonio bakery met while working at Thomas Keller’s Bouchon Bakery--and it shows. Everything is delicate and sophisticated, especially their rotating selection of herbaceous French macarons.

Image credit: @new_fork_city/Instagram

Black and White Cookie: Glaser Bake Shop, New York, NY

13. Black and White Cookie: Glaser's Bake Shop, New York, NY

Black-and-white cookies are as essential to New York cuisine as bagels, pizza and pastrami sandwiches. For the best, head to this 112-year-old family-run bakery on the Upper East Side: The cookies are cakey and lemony, with a fluffy schmear of the famous frosting.

Image credit: @spospis/Instagram

Oatmeal Cream Pies: Muddy?s Bake Shop, Memphis, TN

14. Oatmeal Cream Pies: Muddy's Bake Shop, Memphis, TN

Think of this as the best Little Debbie you ever had.

RELATED: Red Velvet Whoopie Pies

Image credit: @foodnomz/Instagram

Orange Habanero Chocolate Chip Cookie: Hello Robin, Seattle, WA

15. Orange Habanero Chocolate Chip Cookie: Hello Robin, Seattle, WA

A little bit sweet, a little bit tangy and a little bit spicy, this sophisticated sweet is a total flavor bomb. Make sure to pair it with a dish of ice cream from Robin’s partner Molly, who opens a seasonal scoop shop out of the bakery in the summer.

Image credit: @empirestateof_food/Instagram

Chocolate Chip Walnut Cookie: Levain Bakery, New York, NY

16. Chocolate Chip Walnut Cookie: Levain Bakery, New York, NY

These giant lumps of sinfully (read: perfectly) undercooked dough are Instagram ready….if you can manage to take a picture before diving in headfirst.

Image credit: @kthayer/instagram

Garbage Cookie: Meeting Street Café, Providence, RI

17. Garbage Cookie: Meeting Street Café, Providence, RI

The cookies at this college town favorite are the size of hubcaps. Get a Garbage Cookie, with chocolate chunks, white chocolate, raisins, coconut, walnuts and pecans, and then invite over a football team to help you finish it.

Image credit: @milkjarcookies/Instagram

Birthday Cookie: Milk Jar Cookies, Los Angeles, CA

18. Birthday Cookie: Milk Jar Cookies, Los Angeles, CA

We can’t imagine a happier cookie than this rainbow sprinkle bomb. Perfect for a kid’s birthday party, or any rainy afternoon that needs a little cheer.

Image credit: Fluff Bake Bar

Fluffernutter Cookie : Fluff Bake Bar, Houston, TX

19. FLUFFERNUTTER COOKIE: Fluff Bake Bar, Houston, TX

We’re all about fluffernutter sandwiches, except for from now on, we’re taking this Houston sweet shop’s approach: peanut-butter-oat biscuits instead of bread, and peanut-butter cream cheese along with the marshmallow fluff in the middle. Just make sure there’s an ice-cold glass of milk on the side.

item.title: The Internet Loves This Dad's Epic Dressing-His-Kid Fail
item.description:
Image credit: Brooke Hawley-Basso/Facebook

Dads: Bless ‘em. In the era of equal parenting they work so hard to get it right. And while nine times out of ten they nail it, sometimes they send their children to daycare wearing an itty bitty overall set with nothing underneath.

Such was the case with poor Jeremy Basso, a nice-enough sounding guy from Indiana, who (in attempt to help out) dressed his daughter Olivia accordingly and sent her off for the day. The daycare center thought the whole thing was so funny they took a picture, and Olivia’s mom thought it was so funny she posted said picture on Ellen DeGeneres’ Facebook page. And the rest, as they say, is viral internet history.
