item.title: The One Thing That Will Make Your Eggs Taste a Million Times Better
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Whenever you order scrambled eggs at a restaurant, they’re fluffy and delicious, but when you try to make them at home, they always taste sort of meh.  

That’s because you haven’t been using one key ingredient--which is quite possibly already on your breakfast plate.

It’s time to embrace bacon grease.

What do I need? Eggs, salt and pepper, milk and a few strips of bacon.

How do I make it? Beat three eggs with a sprinkle of salt and pepper and a drop of milk. Fry three or four strips of bacon until crispy and set aside. Rather than discard the leftover bacon grease, use it to coat the bottom of the frying pan. Add your egg mixture to the pan and scramble as usual.

That’s it? You bet. Just don’t forget about that bacon on the side.

RELATED: PSA: Steaming Your Eggs is Faster Than Hard-Boiling Them
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 6 Target Shopping Perks You Had No Idea Existed
item.description:
Let’s get real for a sec: A weekend without a trip to Tarjay isn’t really a weekend at all. Here, six shopping perks offered by the mega retailer that will completely change the way you shop.

RELATED: 9 Sephora Perks You Didn’t Know Existed

Image credit: Vince Talotta/Getty Images

YOU CAN RETURN THINGS BY MAIL FOR FREE

YOU CAN RETURN THINGS BY MAIL FOR FREE

No more schlepping to the store because you decided you actually don’t want the three DVDs you bought by the register on impulse. Instead, visit Target’s online return center and print a prepaid return label (Amazon-style) and send it back for a refund, all expenses paid.

Image credit: Frederic J. Brown/Getty Images

AND ASK FOR PRICE RAIN CHECKS

AND ASK FOR PRICE RAIN CHECKS

This only counts for sale items, but if you get a notice that a certain category of merchandise (say shoes) are on sale only to arrive and discover the item or your size is out of stock, flag a Target employee and ask for a price rain check. You'll get a receipt that’s basically a make-good--aka you can cash in and get the same sale price as soon as the item is re-stocked.

Image credit: Phillipe Huguen/Getty Images

YOU GET CASH BACK FOR BRINGING YOUR OWN BAGS

YOU GET CASH BACK FOR BRINGING YOUR OWN BAGS

Yep, for every BYO reusable bag (like the canvas kind) you shop with, Target will give you five cents off your purchase. Sure, it’s not a huge savings, but depending on how often you visit the retailer, it can really add up.

Image credit: Lawrence K. Ho/Getty Images

YOU CAN FLASH A COMPETITOR DISCOUNT AND SAVE

YOU CAN FLASH A COMPETITOR DISCOUNT AND SAVE

The next time you’re grabbing an item--say, a new TV--and notice that Amazon (or another Target competitor) is offering it for less, alert customer service. Target offers price matching for a pretty long list of competitors, which means you can still save. (FYI, you also have a full 14 days to ask for the adjustment.) 

RELATED: 6 Ways To Score Shopping Deals When You Left All Your Coupons At Home

Image credit: Twenty20

YOU GET 15 PERCENT OFF UN-BOUGHT REGISTRY ITEMS

YOU GET 15 PERCENT OFF UN-BOUGHT REGISTRY ITEMS

So you totally wanted that KitchenAid mixer for your wedding, but sadly, none of your friends or family went for it. Target actually offers a 15 percent discount on purchases not picked up, which makes it easier to get everything you wanted after the fact. Bonus: This discount applies to baby registries and college registries, too. (Yes, those are a thing.)

Image credit: Portland Press Herald/Getty Images

IF YOU OPEN A TARGET CREDIT CARD, YOU GET 5 PERCENT BACK

IF YOU OPEN A TARGET CREDIT CARD, YOU GET 5 PERCENT BACK

True story: Shopping at Target is a slippery slope. But if you’re buying everything from your groceries to your bathing suits there, opening up a Target card means you’ll get 5 percent cash back on every purchase, not to mention free shipping and an extra 30 days for returns. Not bad.

RELATED: The App That Maximizes Credit Card Rewards
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 5 Super-Easy Exercises to Relieve Computer Fatigue
item.description:
Whether you have a desk job or not, chances are you spend an exorbitant amount of time hunched over your laptop/desktop/smartphone. That’s why we decided to pull together five quick exercises to help ease any symptoms caused by computer strain.

RELATED: 6 Ways To Work Out At Your Desk

Image credit: Twenty20

TO RELIEVE SORE TEXTING THUMBS: TAP YOUR FINGERS

TO RELIEVE SORE TEXTING THUMBS: TAP YOUR FINGERS

Ever heard of “smartphone claw”? It’s what happens if you don’t take a three-second break from texting to stretch your thumbs. The cure: Put down your phone, then tap each finger to your thumb five times in a row. Three sets should be enough to alleviate cramping. 

Image credit: Twenty20

TO CURE SELFIE ELBOW: ROTATE YOUR WRISTS

TO CURE SELFIE ELBOW: ROTATE YOUR WRISTS

It sounds silly, but doctors have confirmed: Selfie elbow (a condition caused by snapping too many pics of your own beautiful face) is real. To relieve it, simply extend your arm, make a loose fist and gently bend your wrist up and down. Repeat once a day, depending on the number of selfies you take, of course.

Image credit: Twenty20

TO LOOSEN A TIGHT "TECH NECK": DO SOME DESK YOGA

TO LOOSEN A TIGHT "TECH NECK": DO SOME DESK YOGA

The sitting cow pose is our go-to. If your neck is feeling tight from lack of movement, bring your left arm behind your back by your waist and your right arm up and behind your head. Clasp your fingers together--only as far as you can reach--and hold. Take a couple of deep breaths and repeat on the opposite side. (Bonus points if you can visualize a gorgeous island at the same time.)

RELATED: The 20-Second Cure For a Stiff Neck

Image credit: Twenty20

TO RELIEVE SHOULDER TENSION: SHRUG THEM

TO RELIEVE SHOULDER TENSION: SHRUG THEM

Think about it: Every time a string of stressful emails comes in, your shoulders instinctively start to curve forward and tighten as you fire off reply after reply. To re-align them, inhale deeply and shrug, lifting your shoulders up as far as you can toward your ears. Hold for a few seconds, then drop 'em. (And remember: You don’t have to write back right away!)

Image credit: Twenty20

TO REST TIRED EYES: BLINK (OR FOLLOW THE 20-20-20 RULE)

TO REST TIRED EYES: BLINK (OR FOLLOW THE 20-20-20 RULE)

Guys, Computer Vision Syndrome is real. (It’s basically an umbrella term for all the eye problems caused by staring at a screen for extended periods of time.) To fight it, the fix is simple: Blink. It might feel like you have to make a concerted effort at first, but eventually opening and closing your eyes will feel more natural. A back-up plan: Set a calendar reminder for the 20-20-20 rule. (Every 20 minutes, pause what you’re doing and gaze at a point that’s 20 feet away from you for 20 seconds.) Your eyes will thank you, promise. 

RELATED: 8 Things You Need to Do If You Sit at a Computer All Day
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: How to Instantly Brighten Up Yellow Nails
item.description:
Image credit: Getty Images

Dark polish. Back-to-back gels. Peeling a bunch of oranges to snack on. There are a number of reasons why your nails are stained yellow, but one easy fix for getting them to gleam again. 

What you need: A tube of whitening toothpaste and a nail brush (a clean toothbrush works, too).

What you do: Squeeze and spread a pea-sized amount of toothpaste onto each nail so the stains are completely covered. Let it sit for a few minutes (maybe check out that day’s Snapchat filters?) and then gently scrub your nails with the brush. Rinse hands thoroughly and repeat as needed.

Why it works: The active brightening ingredients in your toothpaste (peroxide and baking soda) lift discoloration from your nails the same way they do your teeth. No more gel-mani regret.

RELATED: THE COOLEST WAY TO MEND A BROKEN NAIL
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 5 Things Every Woman Should Do Alone Once
item.description:
We love our friends and we love our family, but sometimes we delight in being by ourselves. It’s relaxing, and it brings a whole new level of “I got this” independence. Here, five things every woman should do solo--just once in her life.

RELATED: Woman Honeymoons Alone, Causing Us All to Wonder How Necessary Husbands Really Are

Image credit: Twenty20

Go on a vacation

Go on a vacation

While a rambling Eat, Pray, Love-style journey of self-discovery is the dream, even a one-night solo stay at a fancy hotel can feel restorative. Nervous to go it alone? Start small by building a little on-your-own time into group vacations. (Getting away from meddling Aunt Marcia is never a bad thing, lest you forget.)

Image credit: Twenty20

Be a tourist in your own city

Be a tourist in your own city

If you don’t have any kind of vacation on the horizon, take a solo day trip instead, and rediscover your own city or state. Living in a place, you rarely see it the way outsiders do, so try to mimic the tourist experience and get a new perspective on the sights that surround you.

Image credit: Twenty20

Go out to dinner

Go out to dinner

Guys, dining alone is awesome. First of all, there’s no pressure to make small talk, meaning you can just chill out and enjoy your rigatoni. Secondly, you can actually focus on eating mindfully--chewing and enjoying what’s on your plate. Thirdly: people watching!

Image credit: Twenty20

Go to a Movie or Play

Go to a Movie or Play

If you’re anxious about going solo to a place where most people will be in groups, a movie is an awesome place to start, since it’s super dark and anonymous and you don’t have to share your popcorn. Bonus: not having to convince anyone to go see the guilty pleasure Nicholas Sparks flick with you at 9 on a Tuesday.

RELATED: This Trick Will Change How You Eat Movie Theater Popcorn Forever

Image credit: Twenty20

Attend a Party

Attend a Party

This one seems intimidating, but once you do it, you’ll realize that it’s not that bad--and an excellent opportunity to expand your social circle or professional network. Plus, if all else fails, you can always whip out one of these five foolproof conversation starters.

RELATED: 5 Essential Life Skills Every Introvert Should Master

item.title: Guys, the Photos From Kristen Bell's $142 Wedding Are the Cutest
item.description:
In case you missed it over the weekend, Kristen Bell dropped by CBS Sunday Morning to delight us all with never-before-seen pics from her super low-key 2013 wedding to hubby Dax Shepard. The couple--who also recorded a pretty epic music video on their last vacation before having babies--tied the knot in a Beverly Hills courthouse for a grand total of $142. (According to an interview Shepard did on Jimmy Kimmel, that number even included the cost of fuel to get there. Whoa.) Skip ahead to minute 4:40 to get to the good relationship stuff. And try not to pass out from adorableness.

item.title: 6 Money Mistakes Pretty Much Everyone Makes
item.description:
You pride yourself on having a good grip on your finances…or do you? Here, six mistakes you might be making. (It’s OK--they’re easy to fix.)

Image credit: Universal Pictures

YOU DON'T HAVE A SOLID STRATEGY FOR PAYING OFF DEBT

YOU DON'T HAVE A SOLID STRATEGY FOR PAYING OFF DEBT

Sure, making the minimum monthly payments on your credit cards is a good starting point, but if you don’t focus on the big picture--like the total amount of debt and how much your APR adds to it--you can seriously hurt your bottom line. A better approach: Keep making your monthly payments, of course, but get a grip on exactly how much you owe so you can come up with a plan for paying it off. (For example, the snowball approach, where you knock out the smallest debt first, or the avalanche, where you tackle the card with the highest APR.)

Image credit: NBC

You overspend on (or forget to budget for) gifts

You overspend on (or forget to budget for) gifts

No, we’re not just talking about the holiday season, but rather the fun (and not always expected) celebrations that spring up throughout the year, like your nephew’s graduation, your cousin’s wedding, your BFF’s 40th birthday. You might not keep tabs on these expenses, but $50 here and $100 there really adds up. To stay on top of it, try adding a separate budget line for gifts or give yourself a spending cap on occasions for others. (C’mon, you’ve known about that wedding in Tulsa for aeons.)

Image credit: American Empirical Pictures

YOU USE YOUR DEBIT CARD TO RESERVE RENTAL CARS OR HOTEL ROOMS

YOU USE YOUR DEBIT CARD TO RESERVE RENTAL CARS OR HOTEL ROOMS

As long as you swap it for your credit card when you check out, it’s all good, right? Wrong. Making travel reservations on your debit card--even if you pay the actual bill with a credit card--can result in major overdraft fees. Here’s why: A lot of rental-car companies and hotels put a hold on your account in the form of a refundable deposit for up to 15 days until they can reconcile all the charges (room service, minibar, etc.). And since computer systems move slowly, they don’t always realize that you paid with a different card. The result? Limited access to the funds in your checking account for up to half a month.

Image credit: Bravo

YOU'RE PAYING WAY TOO MUCH IN BANK FEES

YOU'RE PAYING WAY TOO MUCH IN BANK FEES

Beware those $2 ATM fees. It may come as a surprise, but there are actually a lot of financial institutions (like Fidelity and Charles Schwab) that won’t charge you for “perks” like checks and out-of-network cash withdrawals. Find them. Switch to them. Or threaten to leave your current bank if they don’t waive the fees.

RELATED: 7 Ways To Never, Ever Pay ATM Fees

Image credit: NBC

YOU DON'T MAKE AUTOMATIC DEPOSITS INTO SAVINGS

YOU DON'T MAKE AUTOMATIC DEPOSITS INTO SAVINGS

This is the one and only time it’s a good idea to “set it and forget it.” Determine a dollar amount you’re comfortable putting aside once or twice a month, and alert your bank to automate the deposit. You’ll be amazed at how quickly you accrue a hefty balance, which you can save for emergencies…or spend on a vacation in Paris.

Image credit: NBC

YOUR NAME ISN'T ON YOUR MORTGAGE OR CAR TITLE

YOUR NAME ISN'T ON YOUR MORTGAGE OR CAR TITLE

Of course you and your spouse co-own the house and the car. But if, for whatever reason, only one of your names is on the title deed, it could be pretty challenging to resolve your assets in a court of law should a problem (with the house or car or your relationship) come to pass. Updating the paperwork isn’t as hard as you would think: Simply contact your lender or the DMV to get the ball rolling.

RELATED: 8 Things First-Time Home Buyers Never Realize
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: The 5 Biggest Trends in Wedding Hairstyles
item.description:
Selecting the hairstyle for the one day you’ll look back on photographic evidence of for decades can be, well, anxiety-inducing. Especially if you want to feel current but not too trendy. So we turned to Pinterest to find ideas that will work for summer, winter and everything in between. (Oh, and check out our Wedding Hairstyles board for even more inspiration.)

Image credit: Christine Doneé

Wavy Hair

Wavy Hair

Always a winner for weddings with a natural aesthetic. This voluminous look can work with long or short hair. And bonus: If you have highlights or lowlights, even better, as the waves will showcase the change in shades.  

Image credit: Twenty20

Relaxed Updos

Relaxed Updos

Yes, we’ve seen a lot of updos in our day, but there are some that stand out from the rest. The trick is contained messiness that still has shape and structure. 

Image credit: @ulyana.aster/Instagram

Unexpected Accessories

Unexpected Accessories

The right accessory can elevate your look (but finding one that doesn’t look like it’s from 1992 is tricky). We love subtle, organic shapes for hair clips and pins that don’t look like they’re trying too hard. 

Image credit: Micah & Megan Photography/Style Me Pretty

Long and loose

Long and loose

Soft ringlets and slight waves and maybe a flower or two, this style works with a variety of dress silhouettes and in warm or cold weather.  

Image credit: Green Ginger Photography

Flower Crowns

Flower Crowns

They’re not just for Coachella and Snapchat filters. These full floral arrangements add visual interest and color, and you just might be surprised at how well one ties together your whole look. 

RELATED: The 10 Biggest Trends in Wedding Flowers Right Now

item.title: 3 Easy Cleaning Tasks That Will Make You Feel Better Immediately
item.description:
Image credit: getty images

You barely have time to sleep, let alone give your entire house a full-on deep clean. But if you’re feeling overwhelmed by the mess and clutter, here are three super-simple chores that will make you feel back on top in ten minutes or less. 

Clean your microwave. Sure, you could waste good energy trying to scrub out the crusted splatter from God knows what meal--or you could do it the easy way. All you need is some vinegar, a bowl and something to busy yourself with while the microwave cleans itself for five to ten minutes (here’s how). Oh woah, you forgot the inside was white.

Toss some Tupperware. If matching lids to containers has become the bane of your existence then yep, it’s time to face the monster that’s taken over your kitchen: Let’s play Toss That Tupperware! Keep the stuff that’s in good shape and recycle or chuck anything that’s had its fair share of use. And don’t you dare even think about keeping a container without a lid. 

Dust your blinds. They’re so tedious to clean that you’ve just avoided it entirely. But what if we told you there was a super-easy trick? All you need are some tongs, a kitchen towel and about five minutes. Feels better, doesn’t it?

RELATED: 9 Closet Organizing Hacks That Will Blow Your Mind
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 8 Common Underwear Mistakes We All Make
item.description:
Image credit: twenty20

We all put on our knickers one leg at a time, right? Well, we sat down with lingerie designer and owner of White Rabbit Mariana Hernandez and learned that we may be doing a few things wrong with our undergarments. Here, eight underwear sins you may not even know you’re committing.

1. Wearing a size too small: According to Hernandez, most women tend to buy a size smaller than they should down below. Don’t be afraid to go a size up to prevent the fabric from digging in, chaffing and creating an unflattering silhouette underneath clothing.

2. Wearing the wrong underwear with your outfit: Wearing a tight dress? You’d go for a thong beneath, right? Well, that may not always be the best choice. Consider texture, fabric and color when choosing which style would work best. Sometimes a full-coverage brief is actually a more slenderizing option.

3. Buying underwear with heavy seams: Look for seams that lay completely flat and don’t protrude, which decreases the chance of leaving an impression against your skin and sticking out from your clothing.

4. Wearing mesh underwear in the summer: Mesh may seem super-breathable (it’s made up of tiny holes, dammit!), but it’s still created from synthetic materials like polyester that can trap heat, sweat and moisture. Instead, wear natural fibers like cotton or bamboo that wick moisture away.

5. Wearing white underwear with white clothing: White will create a contrast against your skin, which in turn creates contrast beneath your outfit. You should aim for lingerie that closely mirrors your actual skin tone--from taupe to darker browns.

6. Wearing light underwear with dark-colored clothing: Wearing a nude bra with a black dress sounds like it make sense, but light colors can still show through darker fabric--especially around flash photography. Go for dark colors under darker clothing, and light colors under lighter clothing.

7. Putting your underwear in the washing machine: Hot water, the spin cycle and detergent can take a toll on the elasticity and fabric of your lingerie. Instead, you should hand wash with a sensitive soap, or use a mesh lingerie bag on the cold cycle in your machine. We also recommend air-drying all of it.

8. Not spending enough on your skivvies: Skimping on lingerie is a shortcut that could cost you in the long run, since cheaper underwear usually equals poor fabric that won’t last long. Instead, opt for quality, comfort and durability, even if it means shelling out a pretty penny up front. 

RELATED: 9 Tricks for a Better Fitting Bra
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 4 Genius Makeup Tips for Ladies with Gray Hair
item.description:
Something that’s awesome: Gray hair is now widely accepted as chic. But if you’re letting your natural strands come through, it can also take some getting used to. That means you’ll probably want to rethink your beauty routine and adjust your makeup to your new 'do. Here, four simple tips to keep in mind.

RELATED: The 5 Best Haircuts for Gray Hair

Image credit: Jon Kopaloff/Getty Images

Focus on your brows

Focus on your brows

Eyebrows frame any face, but that becomes especially important with gray hair, which can make you look washed out pretty easily. We’re not saying to draw on cartoonishly dark or thick brows, but make sure to define them with a little brow powder to keep them looking sharp.

RELATED: The Super-Flattering Eyebrow Technique You Need to Know

Image credit: Paul Zimmerman/Getty Images

Highlight your cheeks

Highlight your cheeks

Now’s not the time to shy away from blush. Skipping color altogether might (again) make you look washed out, so be sure to brighten up with a touch of blush on the apples of your cheeks. (On top of that, ease up on the powder, which has the opposite effect of a little strategically applied blush.)

Image credit: Jon Kopaloff/Getty Images

Line your eyes

Line your eyes

When you have gray hair, one of the most important things you can do, makeup-wise, is to make your features pop. That means eyeliner is definitely a “do”--especially if it’s in a warm brown or navy. Depending on your skin tone, you might want to stay away from black liners (which could contrast with your hair too aggressively).

Image credit: Vivien Killilea/Getty Images

Embrace a bold lip

Embrace a bold lip

Neutral colors have a tendency to make your face and hair all look one color--gray. Instead, go for bolder hues like berry or at least pink-y peach. Plus, haven't you always wanted to be Iris Apfel, anyway?

RELATED: 14 Celebs Who Have Embraced Going Gray
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 6 Ways to Sleep Like a Baby Even When It's a Million Degrees Outside
item.description:
Summer sleeping can be a challenge, whether you’re running the AC or not. Here, six ways to keep cool so you wake up feeling sweat-free and refreshed. 

RELATED: The One Thing You Should Do to Keep Your Bed Cool This Summer

Image credit: Twenty20

SWAP YOUR HEAVY COMFORTER FOR A LIGHTWEIGHT BLANKET

SWAP YOUR HEAVY COMFORTER FOR A LIGHTWEIGHT BLANKET

You may think the only way to cool down is with the AC, but a lot of times simply switching out your down comforter is enough to save you from those sweaty nights. Go for anything that’s 100 percent cotton. It’s airy enough to keep you cool and soft enough to double as a top sheet.

Image credit: Twenty20

AND SWITCH OUT YOUR SHEETS, TOO

AND SWITCH OUT YOUR SHEETS, TOO

The higher the thread count, the less breathable your sheets are in the heat. So, even though it feels luxe to splurge on an 800-count set, you should do the opposite in the summer and aim for a lower number. (For example, this 270-count Brooklinen set.)

Image credit: Twenty20

PUT YOUR PILLOW CASES IN THE FREEZER

PUT YOUR PILLOW CASES IN THE FREEZER

This trick will save you from a night spent flipping your pillow in search of the cooler side. About 15 to 30 minutes before bed, stick your pillow cases in a plastic bag (unless you want them touching your frozen peas) and pop them in the freezer. The chill probably won’t last the whole night, but it should keep you cool long enough to drift off. 

RELATED: 11 Ways To Fall Asleep Faster

Image credit: Twenty20

RE-POSITION YOUR FAN AT THE FOOT OF THE BED

RE-POSITION YOUR FAN AT THE FOOT OF THE BED

Sure, it’s tempting to aim it right at your face, but placing it by your feet helps circulate cool air without causing your neck muscles to tense up from the breeze.

Image credit: Makeup and Beauty

MIST YOUR FACE

MIST YOUR FACE

If you do find yourself waking up in a sweat throughout the night, it never hurts to keep a bottle of face mist on your nightstand so you can spritz yourself throughout the night. Nothing fancy, just something to help you cool off quick.

Image credit: Twenty20

SLEEP SOLO

SLEEP SOLO

We’re not saying you should banish your hubby to the couch, but keep this in mind: Once temps hit the 90s, sharing the bed majorly increases the amount of body heat. And if you have enough room, try sleeping in the spread eagle position so your arms and legs don’t touch each other. It’s the best setup for circulating air.  

RELATED: What Your Sleep Position Says About Your Health
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Watermelon Pizza Is Your Awe-Inspiring 5-Minute Dessert
item.description:
Image credit: Dana Dickey

What do you get when you double down on the best of summer? This season’s most delicious treat: watermelon pizza, which is as healthy (dollops of yogurt, agave) as it is sweet (fresh fruit on top and bottom). We’ve adapted this recipe from The Social Kitchen, the charitable cookbook that Brit Dani Tucker wrote in memory of her mother.

What you need: A medium watermelon, plain Greek yogurt, assorted fresh fruit, granola and raw agave nectar

How you make it: Take an inch-thick slice from the thickest part of the watermelon, slather on a thin layer of yogurt, then pile with a mosaic of bite-size fruit slices. Cut into triangles, just like you would a pizza.

And? Sprinkle with granola (to keep it crisp) and drizzle with agave just before enjoying. And be sure to snap a photo before you start--this creation is eye candy from every angle.

RELATED: One-Ingredient Watermelon Sorbet
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Guys, Google Can Now Screen Your Phone Calls and Alert You To Telemarketers
item.description:
Image credit: Google

You’re waiting for an important phone call, whether it’s from a perspective employer or the Seamless guy with your Pad Thai. So you answer the phone when it rings, but--ughhh--it’s just a telemarketer.

Thankfully, a new Google feature is making it easier to screen these totally unnecessary and super annoying calls. It’s currently only available on certain Android phones (and to get it, you just have to update your device) but if all goes according to plan, it’ll reach a wider market soon.

Here’s the deal: when your phone suspects a phony number, you’ll be alerted via a blinking red bar right on the screen. From there, you can obviously ignore the number, but also block and report the telemarketer in question to ensure you never get a call from them again. 

Because no one should get their hopes up over a food delivery only to be met with a robotic voice asking about car insurance.

RELATED: The Only 7 Apps You Need to Get Through the Summer
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Extra, Extra: A New Study Confirms That Old People Still Love Sex
item.description:
Image credit: Tom Merton/Getty Images

Good news for anyone even mildly concerned about slowing hormones: Elderly couples still get it on.

According to new research from the University of Illinois, age had no affect in studied conversations about sex. The study attempted to discuss both the triumphs and the trials of sexuality in older adulthood, along with people's personal strategies for staying active. And in fact, the participating seniors (from 14 different online communities targeting people 50+) surprised the researchers by being rather eager to engage and explore the subject--be that due to an impending sense of mortality or a freer sense of self (comparably to their youth).

"Although some older adults reported abstaining from sexual activity due to health conditions or loss of interest, others refused to renounce sexual activity. Their health problems or society's ageist stereotypes that portray seniors as asexual were not going to become excuses to give up on life--or sex," says lead researcher Liza Berdychevsky.

Can we get a "hell yeah"?

RELATED: Cheers! Science Says That Couples Who Drink Together Stay Together
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 7 Wedding Cake Trends That Will Make Your Mouth Water
item.description:
From tiers of macarons to cakes inspired by rock formations, wedding desserts come in many forms. (And even if you’re still a fan of traditional white cake, you’ve got decorative options.) We scoured Pinterest to find the latest and greatest wedding cake and dessert trends. (Check out our Wedding Cake and Desserts board for more sweet ideas.) 

Image credit: Eyelet Images/Cake: Elise Cakes

Rustic Cakes

Rustic Cakes

If you’re a Fixer Upper fan or just have a thing for distressed textures, we’ve found the baked equivalent. Achieve a rustic look by going heavy on the buttercream icing and topping it off with fresh berries, greenery and flowers. 

Image credit: Natalie N Photography

Naked Cakes

Naked Cakes

It’s all about the exposed outer layers here. (But you can even go with two frosting colors between layers for added depth.) Then make it photo-friendly with fresh toppings like mini succulents or floral blooms. 

Image credit: Asya Photography

Accent colors

Accent colors

More of a minimalist? Lucky for you, bright splashes of color are also gaining popularity. Layer it on in a brushstroke or watercolor design--it’s artful without being overpowering. 

Image credit: The Sugared Rose

Geode Cakes

Geode Cakes

Meet the latest trend to skyrocket on the wedding scene. By using rock candy to mimic a geode’s crystalline texture, you’ll truly awe your family and friends. 

Image credit: Troy Grover Photographers

Dessert Bars

Dessert Bars

Why choose between cake or cookies or doughnuts if you don’t have to? These festive bars allow you to include all of your favorite sweets and give your guests plenty of options. Win-win. 

Image credit: Brian Saculles Photography/Cake: M Cakes

Ombre

Ombre

Playing with gradient colors continues to be a popular choice for wedding cakes. And best of all, it works with various frosting types from fluffy to fondant. 

Image credit: Onelove photography

Macaron "cake"

Macaron "cake"

We love the not-a-cake trends, too. A gorgeous tower of pastel macarons is a genius way to subtly incorporate your wedding colors and give your guests some variety.

RELATED: 10 Wedding Decor Trends That Haven’t Jumped the Shark
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: The 6 Best Everyday Savings Tips
item.description:
You know you should be contributing to your 401(k) or putting aside savings for a kid’s college fund. But when it comes to everyday savings, are you thinking with your head on straight? Our executive editor, Jillian Quint, recently went on financial guru Jean Chatzky's terrific new podcast HerMoney to talk about easy ways to save a little dough as you go about your business. Check out the episode here and some of Jillian's best tips below.

Image credit: Twenty20

Make Your Own Coffee

Make Your Own Coffee

We know, we know--you've heard this one before. But hear us out. If you buy a $4 latte every day, that's $120 a month. Making your own typically costs about 30 cents a day (depending on how much you drink and how fancy your tastes are). That's $9 a month. Is your Starbucks really worth $111?

Image credit: Twenty20

Order your drinks at the bar

Order your drinks at the bar

Going out to dinner with friends is fabulous...unless they drink way more than you do and want to split the bill evenly. Preempt the awkward moment by ordering beverages ahead of time at the bar. That way everyone pays her own way and you don't have to shell out for Tracy's $12 tequila sunrise. 

RELATED: 7 Ways to Not Get Screwed Over on a Group Dinner    

Image credit: Twenty20

Turn money tracking into a game

Turn money tracking into a game

Calling all obsessives. Instead of putting all your energy into Pokemon Go (not that there's anything wrong with that), create a Google doc or a Mint.com spreadsheet to track every dollar you spend for an entire week. After week one, see if you can beat your score by lowering your expenditures. Got a partner? Make it a competition!

Image credit: Twenty20

Buy men's products

Buy men's products

Did you know that stores and manufacturers will jack up the price by as much as 50 percent just because something comes in pink? For items like razors, body soap and conditioner, consider going with the dude-targeted version and saving yourself a couple bucks in the process.    

Image credit: Twenty20

Buy thigh meat

Buy thigh meat

When it comes to the poultry aisle, you should splurge on quality (yeah, free-range) but scrimp on cut. Personally, we'd take thigh meat over breast meat any day.

Image credit: Twenty20

And buy anything you can in bulk

And buy anything you can in bulk

Not only does it save you multiple trips to Target…it can also save you hundreds of dollars over the course of the year. And it’s not just about getting 120 rolls of toilet paper. Small, easy-to-store items like toothbrushes and tampons are great bulk buys, as is alcohol, which will also come in handy when you toast to all your clever savings.

RELATED: The 3 Things You Should Always (Always) Buy in Bulk
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Goats Are the New Dogs, According to Science
item.description:
Image credit: twenty20

Sure, your mutt Milo still totally owns the title of man’s best friend, but a new study published in Biology Letters recently found that goats are actually on a similar domestication track to dogs.

To reach this conclusion, researchers at Queen Mary University in London did an experiment in which they presented goats with a box that was pretty much impossible to open but definitely contained a treat inside. When the goats got frustrated, they did as dogs do: Gazed longingly at the nearest human as if to say, “Hello? A little help?” (You can watch their behavior in action here.)

Compare this with the results of similar experiments done with a variety of animals, like cats and wolves. Cats ignore humans when presented with a challenging task and wolves just keep going at it, determined to get the treat.

Which means? You could be cuddling your very own pet goat in the future. Fingers crossed.

RELATED: Guys, There’s a Farm in Virginia That’s Hiring Goat Cuddlers
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: The 10 Most Affordable Cities in America
item.description:
In places like San Francisco or New York, the cost of living has pretty much skyrocketed. (One and a half million bucks for a studio apartment? No, thanks.) But if you can be flexible and relocate, these ten super-affordable cities will give you the most bang for your buck.

RELATED: Here’s What $300,000 Will Buy You in All 50 States

Image credit: Experience Fayetteville

FAYETTEVILLE, ARKANSAS

FAYETTEVILLE, ARKANSAS

Home to the University of Arkansas, this charming city is also one of the most affordable, with an average home price of $160K. (FYI, if you’re renting, a spacious one-bedroom in the city center will set you back just $500 a month.)

Image credit: Grabill Creative/Getty Images

GRAND RAPIDS, MICHIGAN

GRAND RAPIDS, MICHIGAN

The quality of life (specifically the low crime rates and short commute times) makes this city--the second largest in Michigan--a great and cost-effective place to live. The average home price? It’s just $150,000, with residents spending less than 30 percent of their income on living expenses. Not bad.

Image credit: Twenty20

LINCOLN, NEBRASKA

LINCOLN, NEBRASKA

You can credit Omaha with the spillover into this up-and-coming (but also affordable) city. The average cost of a three-bedroom home is just $145,000 while gas prices are about $1.90 a gallon.

RELATED: These U.S. Cities Have The Best Housing Stock    

Image credit: Twenty20

PITTSBURGH, PENNSYLVANIA

PITTSBURGH, PENNSYLVANIA

The Steel City is still a center of industry, which means there’s a prominent job market, but it also has a super-reasonable cost of living. (Think $130,000 for the average house.) 

Image credit: Ben Klaus/Getty Images

DES MOINES, IOWA

DES MOINES, IOWA

The cost of living in this Midwestern city is mega affordable. In fact, residents tend to spend about 25 percent of their total income on housing. (A four-bedroom, three-bathroom will set you back around $115,000.) Movie tickets cost about $7 a pop, while the going rate for cocktails is about $6.

Image credit: Twenty20

COLORADO SPRINGS, COLORADO

COLORADO SPRINGS, COLORADO

Housing here costs just slightly more than the national average (about $220K for a three-bedroom), but a glass of Sauv Blanc at a fancy restaurant will run you only about $5 a glass. Hey, priorities.

RELATED: Here’s The Best Time of Year To Visit These 13 U.S. Cities

Image credit: Twenty20

BATON ROUGE, LOUISIANA

BATON ROUGE, LOUISIANA

The tax rate here is just 5 percent and the cheap cost of living means that a four-bedroom house typically clocks in at $150K. And that’s not all: A beer is about $3 and gas is just $1.75 a gallon.

Image credit: Twenty20

KANSAS CITY, MISSOURI

KANSAS CITY, MISSOURI

It’s a buyer’s market in this food- and culture-filled town--the median housing price is $110K for a three- or four-bedroom. Plus, a pair of movie tickets (perhaps to the iconic Alamo Drafthouse) will set you back only $10 a pop. (Compare that to $15 per ticket at the Times Square AMC in New York.)

Image credit: Twenty20

CHARLOTTE, NORTH CAROLINA

CHARLOTTE, NORTH CAROLINA

Good news: Residents of this gorgeous Southern city spend less than 30 percent of their income on housing. (The average cost of a four-bedroom is around $170K.) As for other expenses: A gym membership clocks in at $40 a month, while gas is about $1.81 a gallon. 

Image credit: Ian Aberle/Flickr

AUSTIN, TEXAS

AUSTIN, TEXAS

OK, so affordability in this town may not last long, but as of right now, this music and cultural hotbed actually ranks as one of the most inexpensive places to live in the U.S., with a cost of living that’s 6 percent below the national average. If you buy a home just outside the city, you’re looking at an average house price of $250,000 to $300,000--with public transportation costing just $62 for a monthly pass.

item.title: Holy Moly! Sweet Floral Ice Cubes!
item.description:
Image credit: Sugar & Charm

So far our summer has run on watermelon and Champagne ice cubes. Which made us wonder: What else can we cube? That’s when we stumbled upon the delightful blog Sugar and Charm, where we found these beautiful floral ice cubes, which will factor heavily into the rest of our summer entertaining plans. Here’s how you make them.

What you need: An ice cube tray and edible flowers (like any of these).

What you do: Drop a few petals into each cube of the ice cube tray, then fill to the top with water. After freezing solid, drop the cubes into water or seltzer or--our personal favorite--rosé. 

Something so simple that looks so fancy? We’re in.

RELATED: You Need “Milk and Cookies” Ice Cubes In Your Life

item.title: 6 Ways to Get Over a Slump and Get Motivated
item.description:
No matter how productive we are, slumps happen to the best of us. And that’s OK. As Aaliyah so boldly stated, “If at first you don't succeed, then dust yourself off and try again.” Here, six ways to climb out of a rut and get motivated.

RELATED: 7 Easy Ways to Feel Less Stressed Right Now

Image credit: NBC

Element 1

Set intentions
The word “intentions” sounds kind of new age-y, but it’s really just a fancy way of saying “goals.” When you’re looking to get out of a slump, set goals, whether short term or long term. By defining what you want to accomplish, you’re much less likely to flounder and much more likely to stay on track and actually achieve something.

Create a support system
Once you’ve set your intentions, tell a few friends what they are. You’re way less likely to quit if other people know what you’re trying to accomplish. Think of this as a good kind of peer pressure, adding another layer of accountability.

RELATED: 5 Intentions Every Woman Should Set for Herself This Summer

 

Image credit: College Humor

Element 2

Start with baby steps
Rome wasn’t built in a day, so don’t expect to go from zero to 100 immediately. Instead, set smaller, attainable benchmarks. Then, once you get into more of a groove, move the benchmarks further apart, until you’re totally in the swing of things.

Stop making comparisons
Your experience isn’t identical to anyone else’s, so there’s no reason to hold yourself to the same standards. Measuring your successes against someone else’s will only stress you out more and lead to decreased productivity. So forget about other peoples’ goals and just think about your own--yep, we’re giving you permission to be selfish.

RELATED: 5 Ways to Be More Present In Your Life

Image credit: NBC

Element 3

Fake it 'til you make it
We’re not going to sugarcoat it: Getting back to business after a slump isn’t fun. But being miserable and complaining about it will only make it worse. Try to grin and bear it, and before long you’ll find that you aren’t faking it anymore.

Focus on the positives
Real talk: The last thing you need right now is to throw a pity party. Negative self-talk only feeds a slump, so try your absolute hardest to focus on the positives--whether current or future. Instead of fixating on how hard it’s going to be to get to your end result, think about how great it will be once you get there. Glass half full, folks.

RELATED: 6 Easy Ways to Show Gratitude Every Day
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 5 Brow Techniques You Should Master Once and for All
item.description:
Image credit: Getty Images

Considering that brows frame your entire face, knowing how to properly groom them is probably one of the most important beauty skills to master. Without them, everything else--from your eye shadow to your lipstick--would sort of just float on a blank, expressionless canvas. Whether you’re completely clueless or just looking to improve your technique, here are five ways to make the most of your arches.

Image credit: Getty Images

How to trim them

How to trim them

Most of the time, all you really need is a little snip. To do this, comb your brows straight up with a clean spoolie brush and snip off the tops of the longest hairs only. Then tweeze away any hairs that fall outside your natural arch. There, all fresh and clean.

Image credit: Into the Gloss

How to groom them

How to groom them

Once you’ve trimmed them down, you’ll be able to better assess their natural shape. If you’re generally happy with the shape and thickness of your arches, sweep a clear gel through (brushing up, then out) to set the hairs in place. That’s an easy way to define them daily.

Image credit: The Chriselle Factor

How to fill them in with a pencil

How to fill them in with a pencil

To cover any bald spots or over-plucked areas, use a brow pencil as it offers the most precision. (If you’re a brunette, look for one that’s a shade or two lighter than your natural hair; if you’re a blonde or redhead, opt for a taupe.) Then fill in any gaps by using short dashes to mimic hairs.

Image credit: Getty Images

How to fill them in with a powder

How to fill them in with a powder

If you need to fill and shape your arches, a powder is your best bet because it will give you a softer finish. Before applying the powder, wet a Q-tip and run it across your brows so the pigment adheres better and sets the longer hairs in place. Most brow powders come in duos. Use the lighter shade on the inner corners of your brows and the darker shade through the arches and ends.

Image credit: Benefit Cosmetics

How to get a natural-looking finish

How to get a natural-looking finish

Regardless of which products you use, you should always work a clean spoolie brush through the hairs afterward (again, by brushing up, then out) to remove any extra pigment and set everything into place.

RELATED: THE BEST EYEBROW SHAPE FOR YOUR FACE
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Can You Guess How Tall These Celebrities Are?
item.description:
Image credit: Larry Busacca; VCG; Theo Wargo/Getty Images

Have you ever been watching a movie and for some reason felt an overwhelming urge to know how tall one of its stars is? No? OK, well some people have. And if you’re in the latter group, we’ve got an app for you.

It’s called Celebrity Heights and it claims to be the largest database of--you guessed it--celebrity heights.

Incredibly simple, Celebrity Heights is a list of notable people along with how tall they are, or how tall they apparently are. (There’s still some entertaining controversy surrounding Jake Gyllenhaal’s height.)

Sure, it costs $1, but it’s well worth it for those times when you’re watching that movie with that guy who was in that other thing--and just need to know how much shorter he is than Beyoncé (who is 5'7", for the record).

RELATED: What Movie Was No. 1 the Day You Were Born?

item.title: Geode Wedding Cakes Are the Next Big Trend
item.description:
A quick geology lesson: Geodes are those hollow rocks filled with sparkling crystals and minerals. You know, the ones used to make jewelry, decorate homes and even heal ailments (in some people’s opinions). But recently, they’re taking the wedding world (and Pinterest) by storm--specifically in cake designs using rock candy. Here, 13 geode cakes we’re kind of obsessed with. (Check out our Wedding Cake board for even more ideas.)

RELATED: 7 Wedding Cake Trends to Make Your Mouth Water

Image credit: Red Balloon Photography/Cake: Three Tiers for Cake

Turquoise and Gold

Turquoise and Gold

Seriously. Guys. This is what we’re talking about: marbled agate-like swirls bursting from the middle of the cake (and matching complimentary rock-candy stirrers). The color is everything.

Image credit: Whisk Cake Company

Blue, Silver and Gold

Blue, Silver and Gold

You can also go cooler with silver accents and gradients of deep-blue candy crystals to give the appearance of really gazing into cracked rock.

Image credit: @pommehoonie/Instagram

Rose Quartz and Agate

Rose Quartz and Agate

Lighter colors work well, too. Peach and pink swirls wrap this rose-quartz-colored geode cake, giving it movement.

Image credit: Ali N Garrett/Cake: Intricate Icings Cake Design

Amethyst and Gold

Amethyst and Gold

A rich, royal purple (or deep navy) plus the shine of gold leaf makes this option a bit more formal.

Image credit: Claire Marika Photography/Cake: Carrie's Cakes

Gold, Gray and Pink

Gold, Gray and Pink

An already popular wedding-color trio, these shades coexist beautifully on a three-tier cake. We want the slice in the middle.

Image credit: Corbin Gurkin/Cake: Sainte G. Cake Company

Cool Gray

Cool Gray

This almost icy-looking fondant number was inspired by the Oregon coast and is not entirely edible. (Hint: Those are real geodes and crystals on top.)

Image credit: A Squad Bake Shop/Facebook

Jewelry-inspired

Jewelry-inspired

Go this route if you want just a few artful touches of the design but not a full rock formation.

Image credit: Kakes by Darci

Emerald and Gold

Emerald and Gold

How can you not love the modern coolness of this Wizard of Oz-esque creation?

Image credit: Alana Jones Mann

Fragmented Candy Rocks

Fragmented Candy Rocks

Heads up: You don’t have to go full-on geode to nod to the trend. Another option would be to stud the cake with smaller sugar rocks on an ultra-smooth buttercream.

Image credit: Allison Kuhn Photography/Cake: The WOW Factor Cakes

A Crystal Topper

A Crystal Topper

Super elegant without being over the top, this cake has height, sparkle and dimension. The best part? The sliced agate on top is still made of candy.

Image credit: Angela Shae Photography/ Cake: Irina Murashko

Earth Tones with Accent Geodes

Earth Tones with Accent Geodes

Not quite ready to dive headlong into the trend? Go reserved with a neutral- or deep-toned cake. Then simply top it with real decorative geodes.

Image credit: Taylor Lord Photography

Mini Geodes

Mini Geodes

Another for the faint of heart. You can literally top any cake with any geode.

Image credit: Paper Heart Pastisserie/Milou and Olin Photography

Smooth natural finish

Smooth natural finish

You’d never know this sleek metal-like cake was filled with violet and vanilla bean. But just wait till the guests dig in.

RELATED: 7 Non-Traditional Engagement Ring Stones That Are Trending Big Time

item.title: 6 Menu Mind Games Restaurants Don't Want You to Know About
item.description:
Nothing beats a reservation at your favorite tapas spot on a Friday night. But before you order, beware these six common menu mind games, designed to make you over-order (and, worse, overspend). 

RELATED: Why You Should Never Order the Second Cheapest Wine on the Menu

Image credit: Twenty20

IF FOOD HAS A PHOTO, YOU'RE MORE LIKELY TO ORDER IT

IF FOOD HAS A PHOTO, YOU'RE MORE LIKELY TO ORDER IT

Restaurants know: If the description for lobster mac and cheese is attached to an image (or even a teeny tiny illustration) on the menu, there’s a much greater chance you’re going to order it. Why? Talk is cheap. A pretty visual lures you in quick before you have time to think twice about the price.

Image credit: Twenty20

THE CHEAPEST MENU ITEMS ARE LISTED LAST FOR A REASON

THE CHEAPEST MENU ITEMS ARE LISTED LAST FOR A REASON

You know there’s a $7 burger on the menu somewhere. But listing it at the very bottom, beneath all the other entrées, means you’ll have to spend several precious minutes salivating over pricier food items first, a tactic that can successfully sway your ordering decisions. (Whatever, the bacon-wrapped pork loin is only $5 more.)

Image credit: Twenty20

THE $98 ENTRÉE IS ACTUALLY A DECOY

THE $98 ENTRÉE IS ACTUALLY A DECOY

If the platter of locally harvested oysters seems outrageously overpriced, that’s because it is. Here’s the logic: A menu item priced almost three times higher than the rest makes the $30 to 40 options seem like a steal in comparison, right? And it works both ways. Some people actually order the $98 option because, damn, it must be special if there’s that much of a price gap. 

Image credit: Twenty20

DISHES THAT COME IN TWO DIFFERENT PORTION SIZES ARE ANOTHER TRAP

DISHES THAT COME IN TWO DIFFERENT PORTION SIZES ARE ANOTHER TRAP

There’s no greater pressure than having to choose between half and full portions of Bolognese. Restaurants know this, which is why they use this tactic to trick you into trading up, even if the smaller portion size is fine. (Another reason to ask your server to mime the size of each dish before you confirm your order.)

RELATED: Science Just Confirmed That Pasta Isn’t Actually Fattening

Image credit: Twenty20

BEWARE ANYTHING THAT?S BOXED

BEWARE ANYTHING THAT'S BOXED

Menu boxes are the restaurant equivalent to impulse buys at the shopping register. They’re designed to call attention to inexpensive meal supplements (like a delicious side of rosemary potatoes or grilled broccoli rabe) that won’t cost much but seem to add a ton of value to your meal. (Cha-ching.)

ALSO, ANY RECIPES FROM "GRANDMA"

ALSO, ANY RECIPES FROM "GRANDMA"

Ordering “Grandma’s Secret Meatloaf” off the menu is a no-brainer, right? Not necessarily. The idea of a secret family recipe that’s been passed down from one generation to the next is a tough one for diners to resist. That’s why they sometimes use it to describe an entrée, even if--gasp--it's not actually true. Sorry, Grandma. 

RELATED: 8 Restaurant Secrets That Making Eating Out Way Better
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 3 Brilliant Sunscreen Tricks Every Woman Should Know
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Sunscreen: Used right, it’s pretty much akin to dipping into the Fountain of Youth. Skip or misuse it (which most people do) and you risk getting literally burned now…and figuratively burned later (with premature wrinkles). Luckily, the fix is simple. Here are the three most important things to remember the next time you pick up your sunscreen bottle.

How to apply it to your back

How to apply it to your back

Those sunscreen sprays are a godsend for reaching the middle of your back. But if you’re stuck with just a simple lotion, there’s an easy way to compromise--use your forearms to cover more surface area in one swipe. A bit of cling wrap (see above) works, too.

Image credit: Twenty20

How to apply it to your scalp

How to apply it to your scalp

OK, you’re all but bathed in SPF 80…but neglected to protect your head. At “best” this can dry out your strands and fade your color quickly. At worst, you end up with a red, painful burn all over your noggin. Next time, mix yourself a sunscreen spray (basically, water and lotion combined in a bottle) and mist it onto your hairline to shield your scalp from the rays without having to succumb to hat hair.

Image credit: Cali Beaute

How to reapply it on top of makeup

How to reapply it on top of makeup

True life: The number of your SPF doesn’t even matter if you’re not reapplying it regularly. But how exactly do you do that without ruining your makeup? Try using a sunscreen setting mist or a cushion compact. Your wrinkle-less existence will be worth the few extra products.

RELATED: THE (SURPRISING) FIRST THING YOU SHOULD DO WHEN YOU GET A SUNBURN
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 5 Foods You Should Never Make from Scratch
item.description:
When it comes to meals, making your own is almost always tastier and healthier than getting it store-bought. Except…in the case of these five foods, which are actually way better when purchased out. Permission granted to put away the cookbook.

RELATED: 21 Things Every Home Cook Needs to Know How to Do

Image credit: Twenty20

Condiments (except salad dressing)

Condiments (except salad dressing)

Condiments are inherently supporting characters when it comes to taste, and as such, plain old store-bought should more than suffice. (Also, Heinz ketchup = perfection.) If we’re talking about mayonnaise, homemade might taste a bit fresher, but it has a much shorter shelf life, meaning you’ll have to make it way more frequently. Salad dressing, on the other hand, is not only easy to make, but it tastes better and is better for you.

RELATED: 16 Homemade Salad Dressings That Will Actually Make You Want to Eat Salad

Image credit: Twenty20

Pasta

Pasta

We’re just going to say it: Homemade pasta isn’t significantly more delicious than that box of Barilla you’ve got sitting in your pantry. Making it yourself requires time and skill, and if the end result is only meh, why bother? (Better to focus your culinary energies into making a sauce.)

RELATED: So…You Can Cook Pasta In 60 Seconds

Image credit: Twenty20

Sushi

Sushi

Have you ever seen Jiro Dreams of Sushi? If you haven’t, you should (it’s great). And if you have, you know how much goes into making the perfect roll. In addition to the fact that yours are probably never going to be as good as the stuff made by professionals, handling raw fish can be risky--not to mention slimy.

Image credit: Twenty20

Fried food

Fried food

Frying foods like chicken and shrimp requires a few inches of scalding oil. That oil will almost certainly splatter, cause a mess in your kitchen and---worst case scenario--scald your hands. No, thanks. On top of that, if we added fried foods into our home-cooked oeuvre, we’d be eating way more hydrogenated oils and trans fats than any doctor would recommend.

Image credit: Twenty20

Puff pastry

Puff pastry

From-scratch puff pastry is delicious, we won’t lie. It’s flaky and buttery and pretty close to perfect. It’s also absurdly labor intensive, and very easy to mess up. So unless you’re a trained pastry chef, we’d advise sticking to the freezer aisle stuff--your potpies will still be delicious.

RELATED: 7 of the Best Puff-Pastry Appetizers Ever
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: The 3 Best Apps for Organizing and Sharing Your Vacation Pics
item.description:
You got a little snap happy at the beach. So what? But now your cousins and aunts and siblings all want copies of the pics. Here, three super-simple ways to organize them so everyone can view and download to their heart’s content. 

RELATED: 8 Ways to Free Up Room on Your iPhone

Image credit: Apple

BEST FOR SUPER-SIMPLE SHARING: APPLE PHOTOS

BEST FOR SUPER-SIMPLE SHARING: APPLE PHOTOS

You may not know it, but it actually takes 2.5 seconds to share an album with friends and family directly from your iPhone using the Photos app that comes pre-installed on your device. Here’s what you do: Select the pics from the weekend BBQ that you want others to be able to view (and download), tap the box/arrow icon in the bottom left corner and choose iCloud Photo Sharing. Name your album, type in the people you’d like to share it with and, boom, all your relatives can view.

RELATED: How To Take The Best Vacation Photos

Image credit: Lifecake

BEST FOR DOCUMENTING ALL THE VACATION DETAILS: LIFECAKE

BEST FOR DOCUMENTING ALL THE VACATION DETAILS: LIFECAKE

This app lets you upload and organize digital photos (and videos, too) into a timeline that’s easy to share privately with relatives and friends. Even better, you can add captions and music to create a slideshow viewing experience that’s accessible from any device. (Yes, even your Aunt Sheila’s first generation iPad.) 

Download the app

Image credit: Moments

BEST FOR ROUNDING UP PHOTOS FROM EVERYBODY INVOLVED: MOMENTS

BEST FOR ROUNDING UP PHOTOS FROM EVERYBODY INVOLVED: MOMENTS

Sure, you could set up a private Facebook album, but Moments--owned by Facebook--is a much spiffier experience that’s designed to help you seamlessly sync and privately share your vacation photos with other Facebook users who were there. The best part? Friends can quickly upload their pics to the group album, too. No beach photos left behind.

Download the app

RELATED: Heads Up! Your Synced Facebook Photos Will Be Erased on July 7
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Uh Oh, We've All Been Using Our Makeup Wipes Wrong
item.description:
Image credit: The Misty Mom

Whether it’s freshening up after a sweaty commute, fixing an errant smudge before happy hour or removing a face full of makeup after a long day, face wipes have saved us on many occasions. And when used correctly, they do a pretty darn good job. We know what you’re thinking--what is there to mess up? You wipe on and wipe off, right? Not quite.

What you’re doing wrong: Wiping down your forehead, nose and chin first.

How to do it better: The proper way to use the cloths is to start along the outside of your face (your hairline, neck and cheeks) and then work your way toward the center.

Why it matters: Your T-zone has the most oil glands on your face--and hence, more grime and acne-causing bacteria. By starting along the perimeter of your face, you’ll avoid spreading the bacteria everywhere else. Easy as that.

RELATED: HERE’S A MUCH BETTER WAY TO STORE YOUR MAKEUP WIPES
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: What Might Happen If You Walk 30 Minutes a Day
item.description:
Be honest: You easily spend 30 minutes a day on Instagram, Facebook and Snapchat. (It’s OK, we do, too.) Well, put down your phone and use that time to take a walk around the neighborhood. There are eight amazing things that might happen if you do. 

Related: What Might Happen if You Drink a Gallon of Water a Day

Image credit: Thomas Northcut/Getty Images

You'll Burn About 150 Calories

You'll Burn About 150 Calories

Depending on your weight and the speed you’re walking, you’re likely to burn about 150 calories whenever you take a half-hour stroll. So don’t worry about eating that extra cookie after lunch--you got this.

Image credit: Twenty20

You'll Feel Calmer

You'll Feel Calmer

The act of walking can be relaxing, even if you’re exploring a busy city street and not a quiet meadow. For an even deeper experience, download the meditation app OMG I Can Meditate and listen to a guided walking meditation.

Image credit: Twenty20

Your Legs Will Become More Toned

Your Legs Will Become More Toned

Just 30 minutes a day can strengthen and tone the muscles in your thighs and calves. Pair your walks with strength-training exercises twice a week (lunges, squats, etc.) and you’ll notice even better results.

Image credit: Twenty20

And You Might Reduce Varicose Veins

And You Might Reduce Varicose Veins

Walking regularly has been proven to help reduce the appearance and pain of varicose veins, according to the Cleveland Clinic. (Just make sure you change into sneaks before you start to prevent injury and increase circulation.)

RELATED: The Best Exercises to Do if You're Out of Shape

Image credit: Twenty20

You'll Improve Your Digestion

You'll Improve Your Digestion

After eating a heavy meal, don’t flop down on the couch in front of the TV. A 30-minute walk will help get things moving in your digestive tract and keep your blood sugar levels more stable, notes The New York Times.

Image credit: Twenty20

And You'll Feel More Creative

And You'll Feel More Creative

You know what won’t get your creative juices flowing? Watching Friends reruns. (We still love you, Chandler.) When you go for a walk, bring a notebook with you. You’ll be surprised how easily creative ideas pop up when you’re on the move and clearing your head.

Image credit: Twenty20

You'll Get Errands Done on the Go

You'll Get Errands Done on the Go

Something else you can take on that walk: your phone. Use the time to catch up with long-distance friends and family. Or, hell, make that dentist appointment you’ve been putting off for weeks.

Image credit: Twenty20

You Might Be Inspired to Exercise Even More

You Might Be Inspired to Exercise Even More

After a few weeks of making this routine, your half-hour walk will become a piece of cake. You might even be inspired to take it to the next level and try a 30-minute run or bike ride. The possibilities are endless, people. 

Related: The Best Time of Day to Run, According to Science
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 11 Tourist Traps That Are Actually Worth Visiting
item.description:
Image credit: Moyan Brenn/Flickr

You travel to see the world, not to wait in three-hour lines to make it to the top of an overpriced observatory deck. That said, certain proverbial “tourist traps” are totally worth the time, money and proximity to sweaty, disgruntled teen tours. Here are 11 of them.

RELATED: The 14 Most Instagrammable Spots in the World

Image credit: Moyan Brenn/Flickr

The Grand Canyon (Arizona)

The Grand Canyon (Arizona)

You could visit the Grand Canyon 100 times and always walk away feeling completely awestruck. While the South Rim draws almost 90 percent of tourists for its breathtaking vistas, and it shouldn’t be missed, you can escape the crowds by also venturing to the North Rim’s less frequented trails.

Image credit: David Phan/Flickr

Ellis Island/Statue of Liberty (New York)

Ellis Island/Statue of Liberty (New York)

Look, New Yorkers--we’ll forgive you for avoiding the overpriced Empire State Building observation deck. But a trip to Ellis Island and Liberty Island is a must. The place is full of history, and you can even scan the books and try to find your family name among the 12 million immigrants who passed through from 1892 to 1954.

RELATED: The Best Vacation Spot in Every U.S. State

Image credit: Alvarez/Getty Images

Tsukiji Fish Market (Tokyo)

Tsukiji Fish Market (Tokyo)

We’re always wary of places deemed the “number-one, must-see spot” in any given city. But Japan’s largest fish market is 100 percent worth it. Go at 5 a.m. to see the live bluefin tuna auctions, where the best-looking, biggest fish sell for unthinkable prices. Before you leave, make sure to grab a traditional sushi breakfast.

Image credit: Dwight Nadig/Getty Images

The White House (Washington, D.C.)

The White House (Washington, D.C.)

OK, it might sound obvious, but no trip to the nation's capital is complete without a visit to what is possibly the most important political site in America. Arranging a self-guided tour through the White House takes a little effort (in fact, you have to submit a request through your congressman). But the experience is well worth the extra legwork, and hey, how many people can say they went to the president's house?

Image credit: Steve Simmonds/Flickr

Anne Frank House (Amsterdam)

Anne Frank House (Amsterdam)

If you’re going to do just one educational activity in Amsterdam, let it be a visit to the secret annex where the Frank family hid during WWII. The exhibits, videos and commentary are exceptionally well done, and you can even skip the massive lines by buying your tickets in advance.

Image credit: Marc Biarnès/Flickr

Sacré Coeur/Montmartre (Paris)

Sacré Coeur/Montmartre (Paris)

Perched atop Montmartre hill on the fringes of the city, Sacré Coeur basilica offers one of the most postcard-perfect, panoramic views of Paris. Climb about 200 winding stairs to the dome, and see the 21 arrondissements sprawl out before you.

RELATED: The 9 Best Places to Get Your Photo Taken in Paris

Image credit: GTSA South America/Flickr

Christ the Redeemer (Rio de Janeiro

Christ the Redeemer (Rio de Janeiro)

Watching over Rio from the top of Corcovado Mountain, Christ the Redeemer stands 125 feet tall with arms wide open. Getting to the iconic sculpture is an adventure on its own--pick a clear day to take the scenic tram ride 700 meters above sea level, through the lush Tijuca rainforest to the top of the mountain.

Image credit: Getty Images

Alcatraz (San Fransisco)

Alcatraz (San Francisco)

Alcatraz is one of the rare attractions that both locals and tourists can enjoy. The ferry ride over, offering sweeping views of the Golden Gate Bridge and mainland San Francisco, is impressive all on its own.But the real reason to go is to see the prison where Al "Scarface" Capone and Robert Stroud (the so-called Birdman of Alcatraz) once served time.

 

Image credit: Getty Images

Angkor Wat (Siem Reap, Cambodia)

Angkor Wat (Siem Reap, Cambodia)

Cambodia’s most iconic temple, Angkor Wat, is sacred in both Hinduism and Buddhism. But religion aside, this relic of the 9th- to 15th-century Khmer Empire is one of the most incredible architectural accomplishments of ancient times. You could spend an entire day exploring the moats, towers, forests and intricate details that surround it.

Image credit: G.S. Matthews/Flickr

The Great Wall of China (Beijing)

The Great Wall of China (Beijing)

Sure, you’ll be walking with thousands of sweaty people on any given day, but there’s a reason why the Great Wall is one of the world’s most visited destinations. The 5,500-mile granite, brick and stone wall was built mostly by hand, with some portions dating back to 770 B.C. Head to the restored section at Mutianyu (about 45 miles outside of central Beijing) for a less crowded experience.

RELATED: 10 Trips That Will Actually Change Your Life

Image credit: Chris Ford/Flickr

The Blue Lagoon (Iceland)

The Blue Lagoon (Iceland)

Don’t go expecting your own personal hot tub, but the Blue Lagoon--a 40-minute drive from downtown Reykjavík--is pretty incredible. The geothermal pool, set on a lava field, is bubbling with rich minerals believed to help a variety of skin ailments. Even durling Icelandic winter when the days are cold, dark and short, the teal, thermal water feels like dream and illuminates the otherworldly landscape.

item.title: Avocado Burger Buns Are the Weirdest/Coolest New Instagram Food Trend
item.description:
If you haven’t heard, the world (and the internet in particular) is obsessed with avocados. We blend them in smoothies and make them look like flowers and even eat the pits.

But in terms of wow factor, the latest avo creation from super cool Instagram account Fooddeco might take the cake. It’s an avocado burger bun. And it looks… slimy.

Basically it’s just a skinned avocado sliced in half horizontally and placed around a burger (meat or non-meat) and whatever toppings your heart desires.

We’re fairly certain it’ll become a goopy green mess after a single bite, but if you’re in it for the presentation, give it a shot. (And maybe eat it with a knife and fork.)

RELATED: 13 Things You Can (and Should) Stuff In an Avocado

item.title: Everything Good About '90s MTV Is Coming Back!
item.description:
Remember the first time you saw Kurt Cobain playing an acoustic guitar in a cardigan? Or the moment you realized your kindred spirit was a cartoon in combat boots? Or any time people stopped being polite and started getting real?

Yeah, '90s MTV was king.

And the cable gods have smiled on us. According to Mashable, on Monday VH1 Classic officially becomes MTV Classic and will air all the best programming from our youths. During the week, expect episodic shows like Daria, Beavis and Butt-head, Cribs, Pimp My Ride and Jackass. On Fridays, you'll find music blocks of Unplugged and Storytellers. But on the weekends, clear your schedule for marathons of early seasons of The Real World and Laguna Beach.

Oh yeah, there will also be throwback music videos--in the middle of the night just like old times.

﻿RELATED: ﻿MTV VJs: Where Are They Now?

item.title: These Hilarious Wine Labels Say Exactly What We're Thinking
item.description:
Image credit: Delicate Estates/Facebook

Gift-giving can be tricky. You want to give something thoughtful and clever and unique that doesn’t cost more than a month’s mortgage.

That’s why we’re all about these awesome wine labels from Delicate Estates. Perfect for everything from asking someone to be your bridesmaid to sending a very cheeky birthday wish, the labels are silly and snarky and sometime a bit NSFW. (We’re particular fans of "Sorry you guys broke up...at least you're still hot.")

They’re also just labels--not bottles of wine--meaning you can affix your chosen slogan to whichever varietal you prefer.

And at $7 per label (plus the cost of whatever Sauv Blanc you’re loving right now), it’s an affordable gift that says that you care--but you’re also bitingly funny.
